cottage.name: Prospect Cottage
cottage.introText:
Two doggies are welcome to join you when you stay at cute as a button Prospect Cottage. This traditionally presented darling little terraced cottage, situated in far west Cornwall is ideally located for nature lovers, dog walkers and those escaping the humdrum.
Once you have driven up the little unmade lane parked up and unloaded the car, two granite steps lead into the open plan living-room with a wonderful warming French stove, perfect for lighting on cooler days making this a year-round destination. The charming, bijou kitchen area with delightful hand-made, hand-coloured tiles and artworks showcase the owners artistic flair and will surely inspire the designated chef to prepare a delightful dish for a memorable meal.
Upstairs is the double bedroom, decorated in relaxing, soft blue and cream hues to encourage a restful night of slumber, and a bathroom with fresh white suite for ablutions at the start and end of a busy day.
Really pretty courtyards to both the front and to the rear of the property are filled with potted plants brimming with ferns, flowers and foliage and provide a relaxing, peaceful spot for a morning coffee, an evening night cap or maybe somewhere to just sit and be.

cottage.name: Buzzard's Rise
cottage.introText:
A cosy hideaway for you and your dog; perfect for those wanting to get away and enjoy the peace and quiet of rural Cornwall with the stunning coastline less than half an hour away. As the name suggests you can enjoy watching majestic buzzards rise over the hills beyond which is really quite magical.
Making your way to Buzzard's Rise through pretty lanes following a babbling stream, you feel the stress of life drifting away. Parking up in the large car parking area you are greeted by a lovely view and of course your cosy abode. Step into the property through the double doors into the light and airy reception room, you will instantly relax. Enjoy snuggling up on the sofa in front of your favourite film or read in comfortable silence from one of the books the owner has left for you to enjoy. Two steps lead up to the chic kitchen/diner, it is well-stocked for all your culinary needs and with calming views over the fields, it is a great place to eat your breakfast.
The double bedroom is at the far end of the barn with a modern flair and the only sounds are the hooting owls and perhaps a rustle of a badger outside, just bliss. The bedroom also has a bright, modern en suite shower-room which is very handy.
Outside, the barn has a private sitting-area with a table and chairs where you will be surrounded by wildlife and can watch the buzzards rise over the fields. There is also a lovely open lawned area where you can enjoy a chilled glass of wine in the evening light and perhaps enjoy a bit of bird watching and the dog can stretch their legs. The owner is on site but the property maintains its privacy, if you have any questions they are of course happy to help.

cottage.name: Little Tregerry
cottage.introText:
If you're looking for a peaceful break for two, you need look no further than Little Tregerry. Located down a country lane, in the heart of the Cornish countryside, with meadows, streams and wildlife all around, this is the perfect place to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life yet be walking on the beach at Crackington Haven after a short drive to the coast, however should you wish to relax into your holiday abode and walk from the front door, you will not be disappointed!
This charming little semi-detached bolthole has been sympathetically styled to compliment its surroundings whilst offering a comfortable open plan living-room on the ground floor, the perfect spot to indulge into a holiday read or cook up the perfect brunch on your first morning thanks to a fully equipped shaker kitchen. As night falls and the stars come out climb the stairs where you will discover a cottage-style bedroom and bathroom on the first floor. Outside, the small patio-area is an ideal spot to enjoy your morning coffee, afternoon tea or that all important sundowner.
Set in over 23 acres, the owners have been rewilding some of the land and there is a lovely newly planted arboretum for you to explore. Little Tregerry shares this perfect rural setting with neighbouring [Coombe Cottage (3858)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-3858.html "Coombe Cottage"), and the very helpful but discreet owners, along with their chickens, geese, Margigold and Millie the donkeys and of course, Boris, the Kunekune pig!

cottage.name: Poldhu
cottage.introText:
Enclosed by lush greenery and tropical foliage, you will discover Poldhu; a charming shepherd's hut perfect for those looking to escape the city and immerse themselves in nature. The surrounding garden features a huge variety of exotic plants and delicate flowers ensuring a unique retreat for anyone who visits. The hut's gorgeous, sun-soaked exterior is also complemented by a cosy, rustic interior meaning that rain or shine, there will always be somewhere to relax in this excellent one bed property.
Upon entering the hut, you will be greeted by an intimate interior full of character and charm. Freshly cut flowers and vibrant yellow curtains give the space a homely feel while the arched ceiling and superbly finished wooden walls cover the hut with extraordinary texture. A hugely inviting double bed sits snugly in the corner, topped with plenty of plush cushions to snuggle up with in the evening.
Wake up to the morning sun flooding through the double Dutch doors which open the space up to the freshness of its natural surroundings. Further down the hut you will find a compact kitchen with everything you will need for your cosy break. The beautiful wooden cabinets are accompanied by modern accessories such as a fridge/freezer, microwave and plug in hob, while the sturdy wooden work surface is the perfect place to prepare delicious meals. Alongside the kitchen is a charming dining-area. Enjoy relaxing breakfasts and cosy suppers on the rich wooden table and accompanying chairs while gazing out the window towards the idyllic garden.
Once with sun dips below the horizon, custom overhead lamps drench the space with their warm, restful glow, encouraging you to wind down after a busy day exploring the Cornish coastline. Select one of the complimentary books from the hand-crafted shelves or settle down on the luxurious bed and enjoy the flatscreen TV, perched above the dining-table at the end of the hut. Venture through the door located by the kitchen and you will find a delightful wood-clad bathroom with all the utilities you will need. Refresh yourself in the fabulous modern shower which accompanies a beautifully crafted toilet and sink. Outside, soak up the evening sun with the splendid garden right at your fingertips on Poldhu's raised deck.
Enjoy al fresco dining from the barbecue on the outdoor table and chairs, complete with a parasol, or take a moment on the rounded bench and listen out for the gentle trickling of the garden pond.
There is another hideaway on site [Porth Chapel Cabin (4973)]( https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4973.html "Porth Chapel Cabin") and [Beryas Cottage (4970)]( https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4970.html "Beryas Cottage"), but please note the properties are positioned in a way so you have plenty of privacy.

cottage.name: Pinnock
cottage.introText:
Wind your way along country lanes to this truly delightful retreat that is just the tonic for those looking to enjoy precious time together and escape the humdrum of everyday life. Carefully designed for two, this super little cottage named after the parish in which it is located, is beautifully decorated and furnished throughout, ensuring that you completely relax in no time at all.
From holiday breakfasts on the terrace to an evening stroll along the owners' woodland walk, you are sure to make the most of this tranquil setting and the great outdoors. Set between the owners' home and [Winwalloe Cottage (3774)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-3774.html "Winwalloe Cottage") this is a great base for exploring the surrounding countryside and beautiful coastline of this relatively unknown part of Cornwall. With miles of coastal footpaths and an abundance of fishing villages and towns, great beaches, open moorland and so much more all within easy access, why would you choose to stay anywhere else?
Step inside and you will be delighted – there's an open plan living-room with exposed beams, a comfy sofa to snuggle up on, contemporary very well-equipped kitchen and lovely artwork on the walls. Upstairs the romantic bedroom has a gorgeous king-size bed adorned with beautiful bed linen and of course piles of soft cushions and a stylish en suite shower-room ready to freshen you up for the day ahead. And just what will that day bring…

cottage.name: The Dairy
cottage.introText:
Nestled down a peaceful, leafy country lane, The Dairy is a charming country cottage, stylishly renovated to offer a romantic getaway or solo retreat, with easy access to the delights of the beautiful beaches and fishing villages of the south coast.
The Dairy is a delightful bijou abode, perfect for a well-deserved break at any time of year, and even your four-legged friend is welcome. Part of the small and secluded Lee Barton Cottages collection, you have the freedom to explore the delightful grounds and woodlands with just the sounds of the countryside to accompany you. The owners live on site and are available should you have any questions, and their two very friendly dogs are always happy to say hello!
Step inside and the sitting/dining-room will instantly have you feeling at home, with the warm glow from the electric fire keeping you cosy when you snuggle up on the sofa. Down four steps the pretty kitchen awaits with all the equipment you will need to cook a holiday meal and those countryside views to admire through the window. The pretty bedroom on this floor has a comfy king-size bed for a restful night and the en suite has a shower cubicle, ideal after a busy day of exploring the delights of south Cornwall.
From the sunny patio the sights and sounds of the countryside will keep you entertained from dawn until dusk, listen as you unwind in your tranquil surroundings. The large lawned area is shared with [The Stables (5239)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-5239.html "The Stables") next door, each property has its own patio and these are out of sight of each other. You are welcome to explore the owners' grounds and surrounding woodland, and with a fabulous choice of walks from the cottage, your dog will be very pleased with your holiday choice!

cottage.name: The Stables
cottage.introText:
For a tranquil escape in a rather special setting, The Stables is just the place. Sleeping two, dog-friendly and tucked away in the glorious south Cornwall countryside, this cosy semi-detached cottage is sure to offer a peaceful holiday any time of the year.
All on one level, the lovely and light open plan living space has a Shaker-style kitchen, perfect for preparing delicious breakfasts and suppers with fresh produce from the local farm shop, a sweet dining-table and chairs, and a comfortable sofa with a wood-burner effect electric stove - quite a treat on those chilly evenings! Next door, you'll find the beautifully dressed double bed with a stylish en suite shower-room. And with peaceful surroundings like these, long leisurely lie ins await…
From the living space, the patio doors open out to the sunny terrace along with the large lawned area, shared with the guests of [The Dairy (5238)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-5238.html "The Dairy") next door. The countryside views here are rather special, just inviting you to sit back in the sunshine and soak them up. You're welcome to explore the beautiful woodland walks within the grounds, too.
The friendly owners live nearby, should you have any questions during your stay, and their two friendly dogs are likely to come and say hello when you arrive - the sweetest of welcomes, we think!

cottage.name: Hobbit Corner
cottage.introText:
Wind your way along the leafy lanes to the peaceful hamlet of Trevelmond, in the heart of southeast Cornwall, where this little beauty is waiting to welcome you with open arms and a warm Cornish embrace. Whether you are escaping for a few days or a longer stay, Hobbit Corner is a great base to discover all the delights this part of Cornwall has to offer. From the sun-kissed beaches, clifftop walks and charming waterside towns and villages of the south coast to the wild beauty of Bodmin Moor, it's all within easy access.
Behind the unassuming façade of this charming single-storey cottage, prepared to be wowed by the most gorgeous interiors where every detail has been thoughtfully curated in a countryside inspired palette with luxury at the very heart.
Enjoy a cosy evening in, curled up on the sofa with a good book with the dancing flames of the wood-burning stove creating a warm and inviting glow and share a glass of wine over a delicious supper at the sweetest of dining-tables. The kitchen is a true delight- beautifully designed and fully equipped with everything you need to whip up your holiday feasts and the little breakfast-bar is perfect for casual bites and morning chats.
The super-comfy king-size bed is dressed to impress, layered with luscious linens plump cushions and throws, it's the perfect excuse for a lie-in and when you are finally ready to rise and shine, the shower-room offers Villeroy and Boch fittings and a large shower to set you up for the day ahead.
Perfect for both couples, solo adventurers and your four-legged friend, check yourself in to Hobbit Corner and treat yourself to a well-deserved escape.

cottage.name: Blue Mill Retreat
cottage.introText:
For out-of-season breaks or lazy summer stays, come and immerse yourself in the Fowey way of life at the stylish Blue Mill Retreat. Fowey is a magical place, surrounded by beautiful countryside and scenery. It's the place to rewind and re-energise, so spend your days enjoying stunning coastal walks, lazy lunches in waterside eateries and having some fun on the water.
Tucked away at one end of the town, at the back of the Blue Mill Building, Blue Mill Retreat is really tranquil, yet only a short and easy walk to everything this trendy sailing town has to offer, and a mere hop and skip to the Bodinnick Ferry for when you want to venture further afield.
The epitome of a treasured bolthole, this ground floor apartment is perfect for solo travellers and couples alike. Step inside where warm and welcoming interiors await, beautifully presented with great attention to detail. With a large hallway, cosy, open plan living area, a tranquil bedroom with a separate dressing-room, and a sleek, no expense spared bathroom, Blue Mill Retreat really packs a punch. From the living-room you can access the sheltered terraced area. Shared with two other apartments, there are different levels and areas so you can all enjoy some space of your own.
Fowey is a vibrant coastal town with higgledy-piggledy terraced cottages perched on the hilly, narrow streets leading down to the water. There are many activities throughout the year, with Regatta Weeks, the Fowey Festival of Words and Music, the Fowey River Big Gig and BBQ Weekend, and Christmas Markets. Mosey around the boutiques, art galleries, and independent shops, stopping at one of the many places to eat and drink for some refreshments along the way. Fowey is a popular destination with sailors, with hundreds of yachts and boats bobbing on their moorings. The water is the playground here and if you fancy joining in, book yourself a sailing lesson or hire some kayaks and paddleboards and go off exploring the waterways under your own steam. Ferries cross to Polruan, Bodinnick and Mevagissey so why not hop aboard and see where they take you?

cottage.name: Honeysuckle Cottage
cottage.introText:
This endearing cottage is ideal for a truly wonderful holiday in north Cornwall. So whether you're a walker, a beach lover, a fan of coastal villages and harbours, a foodie, a couple or a solo adventurer, come and escape to Honeysuckle Cottage.
Utterly charming and super cosy, this semi-detached cottage retains many of its traditional features with exposed beams, a huge inglenook fireplace, sloping ceilings (please mind your head) and very thick walls, that create wonderful window seats.
Behind the whitewashed exterior is a surprisingly spacious cottage with a toasty wood-burner taking centre stage in the sitting/dining room, a charming bedroom with a super-king size bed, a useful utility-room and a country-style kitchen.
Outside, relish the chance to relax, soaking up the sunshine on the terrace from your first cuppa of the morning, until sundowners; and don't forget your four-legged friend because they are going to simply love the enclosed garden.
Set along a country road, near the village of St Tudy, you can pop up to the popular community farm shop and cafe to collect your morning pastries, and when you want someone else to cook up your dinner delights, the gastro pub will not disappoint.

cottage.name: Rose's Loft
cottage.introText:
With pastoral views of the surrounding woodland and within serpentine splendour, the conversion of this milking barn took place in 2021 to create a stunning bijou abode. Located a two-minute drive or a ten-minute walk to the pretty fishing village of Porthallow, which is the mid-way point on the South West Coast Path. Also, within the iconic Fat Apples site which has a beautiful community energy yet boasts an exclusively private feel with its own entrance, Rose's Loft is a truly unique hideaway for two lucky guests and is named after the owner's mother, Rose Jourdan (nee Paynter). Rose was related to Colonel Paynter, a characterful landowner that resided at Boskenna House near St Buryan. Although Rose spent her life living in Devon, she truly loved Cornwall and followed the Newlyn School of Painters, a group of artists based near Newlyn from the late 1800's till the early 20th Century.
Ascend the ten steps to your external canopied entrance vestibule, kick off your walking boots or beach shoes and be welcomed by the serene and neutral palette of your humble living space. The petite space is open plan and includes a mini kitchen for whipping up a light breakfast, brunch or supper, a comfortable lounge area and private dining space should you wish to use it, complete with divine glass door perfect for letting both the light and the fresh country air flood in.
The bedroom is spacious and has a comfortable double bed, plenty of hanging space and a brand new shower-room with glow mirror. There is an interconnecting door to the neighbouring property, but rest assured this is completely soundproof and private.
There is an abundance of surrounding land to enjoy at Rose's Loft. This is communal with the very small and friendly campsite that is also on site. There's a wealth of places to settle down with a good novel on a sun lounger or with a picnic under the towering canopies, or by the natural pond where geese, ducks, ducklings and goslings reside. This land is eco conscious and the habitat for the wildlife is encouraged with wildflower meadows and a safer space for the flora and fauna to thrive, yet you still have plenty of space to park your vehicle ahead of your Cornish adventures. The best of both worlds! The Fat Apples site is home to one of the most iconic eateries on The Lizard peninsula, so most guests tend to indulge in the beautiful food that is offered here.

cottage.name: Beacon Top Bottom
cottage.introText:
A cosy little bolthole nestled in the rugged countryside of the north coast. Ideally located to explore this stunning area of Cornwall, only a five-minute drive to the beautiful beaches of Chapel Porth and Trevaunance Cove and half a mile from the pretty village of St Agnes with a plethora of pubs, cafes, takeaways and shops. What more could you need for your break?
Follow the path from the car parking space (about 50 meters away) and up the beautiful granite steps which lead up to the entrance. Receive a whole-hearted welcome when you open the door into the cosy open plan living-room, which is warmed by a wood-burner and styled with vintage, eclectic fabrics and furnishings. There is a simple kitchen-area with a hob and combination microwave which is sufficient but also a good reason to make the most of the local eateries. From the first floor you have far-reaching views across fields and countryside, you might also spy a chough or two in the fields which are part of the owners' organic smallholding where they produce their own vegetables, fruit and organic goats' milk (you may see the owners at work while you enjoy your morning coffee).
Following the stairs down, you will find the cosy bedroom and shower-room. The bedroom has such a snug feel with a charming vintage bedframe but of course top quality mattress, heavy quilts and warming hues for a peaceful night's slumber. The shower-room has a large walk-in shower which is perfect for a refreshing yourself after a day exploring the coast path. Open the stable door out to a sheltered patio (which is fully enclosed and dog escape proof) with a sitting-area covered with a glass roof. The perfect spot to put your feet up with a refreshing beer on the deck chair at the end of the day.

cottage.name: Winwalloe Cottage
cottage.introText:
Tucked down a leafy lane with birdsong in the air, the rural tranquility of this pretty semi-detached cottage will delight those looking for a break from busy daily lives.
Just inland from the coast and set next to Pinnock (4203) and along from the friendly owners' home, Winwalloe Cottage is an ideal retreat from which to explore the lovely countryside and coastal areas of this relatively undiscovered part of Cornwall.
The cottage dates back to the 18th Century and has been updated in the most sympathetic way to provide lovely, comfortable holiday accommodation, decorated throughout in soft relaxing colours. The boot-room, perfect for drying off dogs or damp children after a day on the beach, leads into the well-equipped kitchen/diner where a rustic pine kitchen table provides the ideal space for leisurely meals. An open archway goes through to the cosy sitting-room where you can toast your toes in front of the open fire.
Stairs lead up from the kitchen/diner to the two good-sized bedrooms – one with a king-size bed and the other with twins – and family bathroom. Outside, the sheltered patio is a great spot for evening drinks and star-gazing on clear, balmy nights.
One medium or two small, well-behaved dogs are most welcome, so your canine family members can also enjoy a wonderful Cornish holiday.

cottage.name: The Old Dairy
cottage.introText:
This former Cornish creamery has been converted into a delightful coastal retreat for two. Situated on the edge of the picturesque fishing village of Gorran Haven, The Old Dairy is a ten minute walk from the sheltered harbour and beach where kayaks and paddleboards can be hired.
The semi-detached cottage welcomes a dog and keen walkers will enjoy the scenic coastal walk to Mevagissey, or why not pack up a picnic and walk to the beautiful Vault Beach and Dodman Point for the day. The Barley Sheaf in Gorran is a short 5-minute drive or 15-minute walk away, a lovely spot for lunch or to enjoy an early evening drink. Cakebreads has a great bakery selection and bites to eat, the shop is open year-round so worth a visit in any season.

cottage.name: Pheasant Cottage
cottage.introText:
Welcome to Pheasant Cottage, a cute as a button Cornish cottage nestled in a rather lovely location close to the village of Stithians. Perfect for two, this dog-friendly retreat is a wonderful spot to whisk your favourite person away, at any time of the year.
Step inside to find your cosy and welcoming getaway. The beautiful kitchen is ideal for cooking up delicious holiday meals, with a lovely dining space to enjoy them. The bijou sitting-room is just gorgeous, with its beamed ceilings and cottage charm, and promises those well-deserved relaxing evenings after a day of exploring. Light the wood-burner, pour a glass of your favourite tipple and sink into the squishy sofa and listen to your favourite tunes on the mini Hi-fi with Bluetooth and USB connection thoughtfully provided for your enjoyment. You'll also find the shower-room on the ground floor, decorated in calming, coastal blue tones.
Head upstairs to discover the wonderfully restful double bedroom, styled in pretty pastel colours and sure to provide a restorative night's sleep - ready for tomorrow's adventures. Outside there is a lovely sunny patio; a lovely space to soak up the Cornish sunshine and enjoy your morning coffee or supper, or simply spend an hour or two relaxing with your chosen holiday read.
And as for the location, it's just perfect for explorers. Located on a side road leading into Stithians, the area's stunning landmarks are within easy reach either by car or by foot. Stithians Lake is right on your doorstep, inviting unforgettable outdoor adventures. There are plenty of water sports to choose from, including kayaking, paddleboarding and windsurfing, and you can also enjoy a leisurely walk around the lake and sunny picnics on the grass. You'll also find the wonderful Wild Vibes Cafe here, ideal for a delicious breakfast or tasty lunch, and coffee and cake too.

cottage.name: The Nest
cottage.introText:
One of a collection of fabulous apartments located in The Headland in the traditional Cornish fishing village of Coverack, The Nest is a beautifully furnished bijou abode, perfect for either a couple's getaway or a solo retreat and ideally placed to explore the best of The Lizard and west Cornwall.
The porch area at The Headland is communal with the additional benefit of a laundry-room, which is pay per use. The Nest is situated on the first floor of this grand residence and you will feel at home from the moment you step over the threshold. The sitting-room is stylishly furnished with cosy sofas around the log-effect electric fire, making this the ideal getaway throughout the year. For evenings in, the Smart TV and Sky Sports channel will keep you entertained and do take a look at the fabulous artwork on the walls, these gorgeous images were taken by the owners during their travels to the Galapagos Islands. A dining-table is tucked away in a corner, the perfect spot to chat over dinner or play a board game perhaps. The small kitchen is separate and has all you need to cook a holiday meal.
Through to the bedroom and what a delight it is! Decorated in cool white and complemented by beautiful painted oak furniture, you are assured of a restful night here. The shower-room is ideal for a refreshing shower after a busy day of exploring.
Outside, there are spacious communal gardens with stunning sea views to explore and a tennis court which you are welcome to use and rackets are available in the apartment.

cottage.name: The Barn at Little Windsor
cottage.introText:
Nestled in the exceptionally pretty Looe valley, with wonderful views across the rolling countryside, come and immerse yourself in Cornish charm, rural bliss and a wonderful wildlife haven at this delightful barn conversion for two and your tail wagging friend.
Set on the outskirts of the little village of St Keyne and only four miles from the coastal footpaths and the seaside town of Looe, The Barn at Litle Windsor serves up the perfect blend of coast and countryside.
This lovingly restored retreat offers a warm welcome from the friendly owner who lives on site - ready to assist if needed, but always respectful of your privacy. From the moment you arrive, you're invited to relax and unwind in their little slice of heaven and take life at a gentler pace. Start the day with a morning cuppa in the garden, enjoy a lazy lunch in the sunken terrace or stargaze with your favourite tipple in hand, with the songs of the birds serenading you throughout your day.
Inside reverse level accommodation is the order of the day, to make the most of the views. On the ground floor, the bedroom is adorned with lovely linens that perfectly complement the setting and here you will also find the shower-room, convenient not just for your morning shower but should you want to come in and rinse off straight away after a day on the beach or a countryside ramble.
Upstairs you'll find the open plan living-room, the place to settle down for cosy moments on the sofas and when it's time to dine, you are promised a table with a view at every meal. The sweet kitchen comes equipped with all you need to prepare that nourishing 'Full English', holiday picnics and savoury suppers with some fresh produce picked up from a local farm shop.

cottage.name: Lee Cottage
cottage.introText:
What a delightful getaway this is, set down a tree-lined lane amid the tranquility of beautiful countryside. With rustling leaves and birdsong as a background lullaby, you will relax and unwind in no time at all. Lee Cottage is a single-storey barn conversion, light-filled and facing out over its own secluded garden.
There is a big open plan living-room with archways leading through to the garden room, running the length of the cottage, so plenty of space to spread out.
This tucked-away corner of Cornwall is less well-known, but with countryside all around and the beautiful south coast close by, this is a lovely location. Lee Cottage is perfect for families, couples and dog walkers, with woodland and coastal footpaths, superb beaches and easy access to good roads for exploring further afield.
After days out and about, you'll love returning home and relaxing in the garden to the sound of birdsong or in front of the warming wood-burner in cooler months.
The friendly owners live across the courtyard and are happy to welcome you and offer advice if requested but equally happy to leave you to yourselves so you can relax in peace and quiet. The owners' two friendly dogs will come to say hello when you arrive, offering a warm welcome of their own!

cottage.name: West Barn
cottage.introText:
One of a pair of detached barn conversions tucked away in the tranquil hamlet of Crowan, as soon as you pull into the drive, you feel as though you have stepped in to a story book. The craftsmanship here is very special and the thatched roofs set the scene for a beautiful rural escape from the hubbub of everyday life.
The exposed beams, high ceilings and wooden floors give the barn a calm environment for your holiday. The charming open plan living-room has a modern kitchen, light living space with comfy sofa (which converts into a sofa bed) and we feel this is the perfect spot for relaxing on holiday and enjoying the peace and quiet of the cottage. The bedroom with en suite shower-room is on the left as you enter the property, the high ceilings give the bedroom a lovely airy feel.
Outside the front door is a pretty private sitting-area with a table and chairs, you can sit and unwind while you listen to the bird song with a cup of tea or a glass of wine, whichever takes your fancy. The property sits in 10 acres of grounds which the owners invite you and your neighbours at East Barn to explore and use at your leisure.
From the grounds you can access footpaths to discover the local area with no need to get into the car. The owners are very friendly and helpful, and should you have any questions or if you would like any recommendations they would be happy to help.

cottage.name: Cowries
cottage.introText:
Cowries is a cosy ground floor apartment sleeping two with fabulous uninterrupted views of Gerrans Bay and the pretty seaside village of Portscatho. Situated directly above the harbour and virtually at the end of the Lugger – a row of predominantly traditional stone-built fishermen’s cottages – the apartment is one of a small number set back from a no-through road, which has very little passing traffic.
The village centre with a general store, pub, cafe and galleries is a short level stroll away, and the harbour and beach are likewise immediately to hand.
The apartment (with its own designated parking space) is approached by a short flight of steps from the private parking-area to the front of the property. There is access at the rear to a small secluded gravelled-area; this is a useful space to store kayaks, bikes, etc.

cottage.name: Celtic Reach
cottage.introText:
Perched above the market town of Camelford with commanding views that stretch out to the rugged landscape of Bodmin Moor, this charming pad is only the shortest of drives to the stunning north Cornish coast. Bring the whole family along to be part of this holiday adventure, whether you plan fun-filled days on the beach, a brisk stomp across majestic moorland and coastal footpaths, leisurely lunches at harbourside pubs and cafes or exploring historic houses and gardens, there really is something for everyone.
Decorated throughout in relaxing shades of grey, punctuated with flashes of colour, open plan living is the order of the day to maximise your time together and make the most of the view. Patio doors draw you to that view and lead out to the fab decking-area where meals can be savoured in the fresh air or a lazy afternoon spent chilling in the hammock.
When it's time for bed, the three bedrooms promise a good night's sleep, setting you up ready for the next day's adventure.

cottage.name: Copper Bal Cottage
cottage.introText:
Nestled in the picturesque Cornish village of Goldsithney, just moments from the coast and the hidden gem of Prussia Cove, Copper Bal Cottage is a delightful dog-friendly, two bedroomed terraced cottage which is the perfect escape for couples or a small family seeking comfort, charm and a real taste of Cornish life. Thoughtfully furnished and full of character, the cottage blends modern comfort with a warm welcoming feel, sleeping three guests wishing to explore this stunning part of the county.
Inside this sweet home, the snug sitting-room's central focus is the cosy wood-burner, perfect for curling up by after a day exploring the coast or countryside. Comfy sofas and a huge armchair invite you to settle in on a chilly evening and appreciate the homely feeling. The well-equipped modern kitchen caters for all your needs with stylish crockery and quality cookware. The bright and airy dining-area is a social space to gather sharing a relaxed breakfast, long lunches or intimate suppers.
Doors open directly onto a sweet two-tiered garden. A bistro table offers a tranquil spot for morning coffee whilst in the garden there is also relaxed seating thoughtfully placed for unwinding with a book or soaking up the Cornish sunshine. You can also fire up the barbecue and enjoy al fresco dining of a summer evening.
Up the traditionally steep cottage stairs there are two bedrooms, one with a luxurious king-size bed, full of natural light and one is a small double, both beautifully appointed for a restful night's sleep. A small but stylish bathroom sits between the two, ideal to wash away your sandy day.

cottage.name: Chybean
cottage.introText:
A quaint and cosy Grade II Listed cottage, set in a tranquil beautiful location on a family-run farm.
This charming cottage has lots of little quirky features due to its age, from the sheltered courtyard where you park your car, to the stable-door into the small but perfect formed kitchen (please watch the step and mind your heads) which has everything you might need for a feast of local treats. The kitchen leads up to the cute sitting/dining-room that overlooks the sunny and sheltered front garden. In the winter, enjoy snuggling up together on the sofa watching a film using the Amazon Fire TV Stick, enjoying the warmth of the flickering flames of the wood-burner after a brisk countryside walk, or in the warmer months leave the front door open and enjoy the balmy breeze.
Upstairs you will find the lovely bedroom also looking over the front garden. Fall asleep with the windows open listening to the hooting owls and the dawn chorus, what could be more relaxing. There is also a handy sink in the bedroom and the shower-room is found downstairs, just off the kitchen, so perfect for washing those sandy toes at the end of the day.
The enclosed garden at Chybean is a lovely spot to sit back and relax with your four-legged friend catching the sun most of the day. The footpaths are abundant and right from your front door; set in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and surrounded by the waters of Carrick Roads there is so much to explore. There is a pretty estuary shingle beach only 300 yards down the hill from the cottage, perfect for taking a paddleboard down and exploring these waters.
This lovely location is shared by the adjoining cottage [Chyvounder (5117)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-5117.html "Chyvounder"), which is ideal should you want to holiday with your extended family or group of friends. If you love the water this is the perfect place for you, the owners are able to offer by separate arrangement (on availability) a mooring which is only 300 yards from the property and boat storage, there is also handy launching very nearby and at Mylor Harbour too.

cottage.name: Little Woon
cottage.introText:
Welcome to the ultimate piece of paradise for couples looking to escape on a get-away-from-it-all break. Set in a secluded spot yet close to all that this gorgeous corner of Cornwall has to offer, this idyllic retreat was originally used for boat building and has been lovingly refurbished - with a great focus on upcycling and sustainable tourism - to create the cosy, tranquil and comfortable home-from-home that it is today.
This stunning retreat is a true hideaway, hidden behind the original barn doors - open them up to reveal the entrance, step in and your holiday begins. Enter straight into the sumptuous open plan living area, complete with snuggly sofa, TV and wood-burner - ideal for cosy evenings in, and a beautiful kitchen, equipped for all of your holiday needs, including an electric cooker, microwave, fridge (with ice-box) and kettle. There is also a dining-area, where many a scrumptious supper can be enjoyed, accompanied by a glass of wine or two. Your only neighbours are the lovely owners who live on site and very occasionally use the office space above the barn.
A sliding door opens to reveal the delightful bedroom and its inviting super king-size bed (this can also be configured as twin beds), made up with a white feather down duvet and plumped up pillows - the perfect place to rest your head after a day out and about exploring. There is also a large wardrobe with plentiful hanging space and a chest of drawers, so you won't be short of storage. From the bedroom, another sliding door leads to the spacious shower-room with its heated towel rail and under-floor heating to keep your toes toasty in the cooler months.
But that's not all - outside, reached via patio doors in the living area, is your very own pretty garden (it's enclosed, so great for your four-legged friend). Here you can snooze in the sun, dine al fresco on the decking or cook up a storm on the fire-pit barbecue until your heart's content, all whilst taking in some good ol' fresh air and savouring the great outdoors.

cottage.name: Meadow Barn
cottage.introText:
Whether you’re a walker, a lover of nature and the coast or you simply want to unwind and spend time together then look no further than Meadow Barn. Nestled in the heart of the countryside, this gorgeous single-storey barn conversion oozes comfort and tranquility and is perfect for couples seeking a restful haven. You can spend your days relaxing on the terrace, lazing in the wild flower meadow or wandering through the woodlands and getting at one with nature.
Reached along a private drive, this lovely location is only a few minutes from Cornwall’s north coast with coastal footpaths, superb beaches, pretty fishing villages and towns waiting to be discovered and with great access to good roads for exploring further, what more could you want.

cottage.name: The Dolls House
cottage.introText:
Retreat to our stylish little cottage for two, nestled in the popular sailing town of Fowey, set at the mouth of the magnificent Fowey Estuary. As perfect for relaxing breaks or romantic getaways, The Dolls House is an oasis of calm with exquisite interiors and a sunny courtyard, yet only the shortest of walks down the hill to the vibrant town centre.
Pull up to your private parking space directly outside, a real bonus for Fowey, and then step inside your holiday home where a warm Cornish welcome awaits. Reversed-level living is the order of the day, with the en suite bedroom on the ground floor, so much more convenient for unpacking suitcases and travel bags. The large open plan living-room spreads across the whole of the first floor. It's a wonderfully light and airy room with a vaulted ceiling, and whilst sat at the dining-table enjoy glimpses of the estuary and surrounding countryside, along with the 15th Century tower of Place House, from the window.
If you want to soak up the sun, head outside to the little courtyard. It's the perfect spot to relax with your morning coffee or treat yourself to an afternoon tea - jam first of course.

cottage.name: Wheel Barn
cottage.introText:
A wood-burner and under-floor heating ensure year-round snugness in this lovingly restored, single-storey converted barn, found near the hamlet of Ladock in an easily accessible rural setting.
Impeccably furnished and decorated, Wheel Barn provides an ideal base for exploring while offering comfort for those wishing to stay in and relax. The open plan living-room has chestnut leather sofas and French doors to an enclosed patio and garden with far reaching views over the Ladock valley. Two steps lead down from the dining-area to the fully-equipped kitchen. Beautifully styled, the bedroom also has doors opening out to the garden, and is adjacent to the spacious shower-room.
The hospitable owners live next door and are happy to welcome two well-behaved medium-sized dogs.

cottage.name: Stable Cottage
cottage.introText:
Nestled in the tranquil hamlet of St Mewan with views of the pretty church, this is a rather special holiday hideaway. Perfect for a solo holiday adventure or that romantic stay with a loved one, Stable Cottage offers stylishly comfortable luxury living over two floors.
Head up a short flight of steps and you enter through a wooden porchway into the first floor open plan living space, which is thoughtfully styled in relaxing hues of creams and greys to complement the beautiful herringbone wooden floor and quality furnishings throughout. Relax on the fabulous sofa after a day out exploring, snuggle up in front of the Smart TV to watch your favourite movie or listen to music, create a culinary masterpiece or a tasty snack or head out to one of the local pubs, the Polgooth Inn is only a short drive away as is the Cornwall Spa if you fancy booking yourself a pamper.
When the clock strikes bedtime, head down the stairs to your stunning bedroom where you will find a super-king size bed and an en suite bathroom with walk-in shower and free-standing double ended bath, ideal for a soak at the end of the day - whether you've had an active day walking the coast path or spent a more relaxing day closer to home. Open the French doors and take your bedtime nightcap or morning cuppa out onto your little private courtyard. There's a further private outdoor sitting-area opposite the cottage, a more sheltered space which is perfect to retreat to on a hot sunny day with a cold drink.
Whether a short break visit or a longer stay, this little gem of a holiday cottage may just leave you coming back for more.

cottage.name: 2 Belgravia
cottage.introText:
Perfectly located just a short walk from the delights of central Penzance and with the stunning coast of far west Cornwall a stroll away, 2 Belgravia is a beautifully renovated mid-terraced cottage, ideal for a small family (babes in arms up to six months old are welcome), or a couple looking for a romantic getaway. With miles of gorgeous coastline, hidden coves and sandy beaches waiting to be discovered, along with pretty fishing villages and a wonderful choice of fabulous eateries, let your holiday dreams come alive in this gorgeous bolthole.
Located up four granite steps, 2 Belgravia is simply gorgeous. The moment you step over the threshold you will instantly feel at home. From the beautiful oak flooring to the fabulous contemporary wood-burner, everything has been thought of to make your stay comfortable. Super comfy sofas invite you to relax with gorgeous artwork and well-placed lamps completing the stylish look. The farmhouse kitchen table sits at the far end of the living area where you can sit and make plans for the day ahead. The kitchen sits at the back of the cottage, small but perfectly formed, you will find everything you need here to create a holiday feast. The staircase is a work of art! With a well-positioned porthole giving a nod to this seafaring land, each steep step has been painted in gorgeous turquoise blue hues of the ocean.
On the first floor you will find two beautifully styled bedrooms and the family bathroom. Just off the landing, one small step takes you into the double bedroom which is oh so pretty. With double sash windows, painted floorboards and a beautiful brass bedstead this really is a bedroom of sweet dreams. The pretty single bedroom is perfect for either an adult or child. The family bathroom has a gorgeous claw-foot free-standing bath with rainfall shower over, perfect for either a long soak or a refreshing shower after a busy beach day. Outside you have a bijou courtyard with bistro table and chairs, the perfect spot for al fresco dining from dawn until dusk. 2 Belgravia has everything you need and more for a perfect Cornish getaway.

cottage.name: Pink Cottage
cottage.introText:
Tucked away in the heart of the bustling village of Goldsithney is this cute retreat, a lovingly restored cottage perfect for small families or couples. Arty and characterful, Pink Cottage welcomes you in a traditional Cornish setting.
Step inside to find numerous original features and lots of charm. The sitting-room is a joy and has plenty of comfy seating and a toasty wood-burner, perfect for cosy evenings in catching up on the day's adventures. The owners' interior design shines through in every detail. Through the doorway is the well-equipped kitchen and dining area for four, beautiful local crockery sits on the shelves, sit back and relax with your morning coffee enjoying the simple joy of the local surroundings.
Upstairs you will find two beautiful bedrooms, to the right step up into a king-size bedroom with views of the quintessential English garden and to the left, step up into a sweet room with bunk-beds. A stylish family bathroom separates the two.
Outside the garden does not disappoint, a gravel courtyard leads to an enclosed area of lawn with plenty of outdoor furniture, benches, ornate tables and chairs and a charming summer-house so sit back and catch the sun. Light the barbecue and eat al fresco as this garden is a perfect place to relax.
If you decide to eat out, the village has two excellent pubs both with tempting menus. A handy local shop is also just around the corner with a traditional tea-room. A bus service runs through this delightful village if you feel like leaving the car.

cottage.name: Little Bambaroo
cottage.introText:
What a little cutie! Picture-perfect and utterly charming, this delightful bolthole for two is set deep in the heart of the quaint Cornish village of Churchtown Gulval. Spot the 12th Century Church and you have arrived!
A very pretty little path (with ten little steps) leads through the enchanting garden filled with succulents and other subtropical plants, which thrive in this part of Cornwall. Take a moment to enjoy this beautiful garden, before stepping through the front door into Little Bambaroo.
Brimming with character and style this gorgeous open plan retreat has everything you need for a relaxing stay, with a roaring wood-burning stove to make things super-cosy on those chillier evenings, and a comfy double bed at the far end of the room. You will also find a delightful little dining-area and kitchenette for those who want to cook up a breakfast or a light supper. In the daytime you can sit and dream at the table gazing out the window as you linger over your morning cuppa. A single step takes you into the deceptively spacious shower-room, complete with a large shower cubicle, a must for washing sandy toes and salty hair. Outside the cottage has a glorious south-facing decked area with a table and two chairs perfect for a spot of al fresco dining.
Little Bambaroo is so welcoming you will feel lost in idyllic countryside bliss and may not wish to venture too far. Travelling around this gorgeous part of west Cornwall, the impossibly quaint village of Mousehole and working harbour of Newlyn are most definitely worth a visit. Spend a carefree day mooching around the enchanting little side streets and galleries, before stopping to pick up some local fish from one of the many fish stalls in Newlyn on your way home.

cottage.name: Trebah
cottage.introText:
With a beautiful sandy beach only two minutes' walk away and spectacular sea views from the large picture window in the sitting area, Trebah is a surprisingly spacious studio apartment, perfect for a summer stay or a cosy winter break storm watching.
Open plan living and high ceilings bring light into this welcoming ground floor apartment and with a separate kitchen and dining-room, king-size bed, and spacious bathroom, this is a very comfortable property for two.
The building itself was an hotel once upon a time but is now home to the owner and guests at Trebah. The entrance to Trebah is accessed through a secluded courtyard with a bistro table and chair set. Enjoy a perfectly lazy start here with a morning coffee or traditional cup of builders whilst you plan your activity for the day. The terrace and swimming pool below belong to the owner who is handily nearby and happy to answer any questions or advise on the best places to visit.
Stroll down the hill to the beach or further on to the delightful beach bars and cafes which wrap around Praa Sands beach. It would be hard to beat the location of this little treasure sitting just above the beach in an elevated position.

cottage.name: Little Jenny Wren
cottage.introText:
A cosy retreat for a romantic getaway close to the River Helford, this cute cabin has far reaching views across the Cornish countryside and is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.
The open plan layout allows the day to effortlessly flow; enjoy a long breakfast in bed perhaps with the fire crackling on a winter's eve or a luxurious brunch at the dining-table looking over the valley with the doors open and the spring birdsong delighting your ears. The bed is tucked around the corner for a tranquil night's sleep with just the owls and lowing cows to keep you company.
The owners have lovingly created this lovely space with no details amiss; hand-crafted ceramics, a custom headboard created from locally-sourced trees and little touches throughout. There is plenty of outside space to relax at Little Jenny Wren, the private patio is the perfect spot for a barbecue, perhaps with freshly caught mackerel for supper. There is also a large lawned area which is all yours, perfect for a little picnic or just relaxing on a blanket with a good book.
Little Jenny Wren is found at the end of a farm lane, the cows and working farm dog are likely to greet you on your drive down through this working Cornish dairy farm. The friendly owners live on site and will give you a warm welcome but of course ensure your privacy during your stay.

cottage.name: Orangery Lodge
cottage.introText:
Orangery Lodge is a romantic retreat made for two!
Located on the edge of Mount Edgcumbe, there are over 865 glorious acres of parkland, woods, coastline and Listed gardens for you to explore right on your doorstep, along with the historic house, cafes and artisan shops. It really is a very special place.
Dating back to the 16th Century, once the celebratory archway to the formal gardens of the Earl, this Grade II Listed gateway has been brought bang into the 21st Century with charming interiors, befitting of any Earl, embracing the botanical theme that accentuates the overall character of the building.
From leisurely holiday breakfasts in the stylish four-poster bed, to morning coffee on the elevated garden platform looking out across the waters of Plymouth Sound, or cosy evenings snuggled up on the sofa, Orangery Lodge promises a truly relaxing escape for wonderful times together.
Located at the bottom entrance of the Park where visitors access the gardens and Orangery Garden Cafe, with views from the sitting-room and garden across the waters of Plymouth Sound, shut the world behind you as you step into this stunning little oasis.

cottage.name: Cremyll Lodge
cottage.introText:
Nestled in its own garden within the Mount Edgcumbe Country Park, this is a charming retreat. The park has 865 acres of woods, fields and coastline – your dog will be in heaven!
Originally part of staff accommodation provided by the Earl of Mount Edgcumbe, Cremyll Lodge is a comfortable and attractive cottage. There are views across Plymouth Sound from the sitting/dining-room, a kitchen, shower-room and an exceptionally pretty bedroom found up the steep stairs. A private entrance leads to the enclosed patio ensuring privacy from the little shop and cafe next door and the children’s play-area. The Rame Peninsula, known to locals as ‘the forgotten corner of Cornwall’, is a truly glorious part of the world.

cottage.name: Cobble Cottage
cottage.introText:
Kilkhampton is a charming Cornish village, perfectly placed for exploring the delights of north Cornwall and Cobble Cottage is a lovely terraced abode, situated in a quiet courtyard opposite the village square with traditional inns and food shops all close at hand as well as a well networked bus route!
Whether you are looking to explore the stunning beaches of Bude just a short drive away, travel further afield to the gorgeous villages of Clovelly and Tintagel or stay closer to home and explore the pretty countryside around Kilkhampton, Cobble Cottage has all you need for a fabulous holiday no matter the season.
Accessed via a passageway from the village square, from the moment you arrive you will be captivated by the charm of Cobble Cottage. The cosy sitting-room has a fabulous feature inglenook fireplace, complete with wood-burner to keep you warm throughout the seasons and a Smart TV for your evening's entertainment. The kitchen/diner is perfect for sociable dining and has all the equipment you will need to create a culinary delight. The ground floor has a reclaimed brick floor with the joy of under-floor heating perfect for keeping your toes warm, and characterful beams throughout.
Stairs with handrail lead to the first floor, please note these are typical of traditional Cornish cottages and are steep. On reaching the top there are additional steps into the bedroom as well as the landing leading to bedrooms two and three and the family bathroom. Bedroom one is a charming, spacious room with comfy king-size bed and iron bedstead that floods with light thanks to the double-aspect windows. Bedroom two is a pretty single room perfect for young or old and offers a peaceful spot to enjoy the holiday read. Bedroom three is the perfect twin ideal for either children or adults. Please note there is a small lip/step up into this room, this bedroom has views out to the front of the cottage. The family bathroom has a lovely hand-made suite with a bath and fitted shower over.
To discover the hidden enclosed garden simply wander down a beautiful path/track where just 90 yards away you will discover the private tranquil garden, perfect for relaxing in your countryside surroundings. A patio area with garden furniture provides a spot for you to fire up the barbecue and enjoy al fresco dining, and the thoughtful owners have created a wildflower area too. There's oodles of space for the children and family dogs to let off steam however please note the summer-house is not for guests' use. On the way down to the garden you will also pass the utility-room for keeping your outdoor gear or beach equipment. It also houses all the barbecue equipment, picnic plates and dishes; the owners have thought of everything.

cottage.name: Little Blue
cottage.introText:
In the heart of the historic yet trendy town of Penryn and only a five minute drive to Falmouth is this perfect bolthole for two. Named one of the best towns to live in in the South West by the Sunday Times, we are sure you will enjoy discovering what this pretty location has to offer.
Tucked away down a charming little street in the historic centre of the town, Little Blue is such a peaceful terraced property. One granite step takes you over the threshold where you are met with a light and airy entrance with plenty of room for your holiday essentials. To your left is the sitting/dining-room which overlooks the pretty courtyard garden; enjoy long relaxing breakfasts basking in the morning sun and in the evening snuggle up on the sofa in front of the wood-burner after a day exploring. Please note the Smart TV offers streaming services only and does not have terrestrial channels (remember to bring your login details for the streaming apps).
The little kitchen has everything you might need to create a feast and has a fabulous ground coffee machine to make the perfect morning brew. The kitchen opens onto the sunny courtyard garden which catches the sun throughout the day in the summer months. Upstairs you will find the pretty bedroom and bathroom. The bedroom is at the rear of the house to ensure peace and quiet for your holiday slumber and again catches the morning sun, so enjoy a cup of Cornish tea in bed before you start the day. The bathroom is perfect for a relaxing soak in the tub after a day exploring but also has a handy overhead shower to refresh you after your night's sleep.
Outside you'll find the good sized courtyard garden, quite the sun-trap in the summer months, perhaps perch on the bench against the house for a coffee at the start of the day, or head up a couple of steps to the main patio where you can enjoy long lunches. The owner has provided a charcoal barbecue so you can cook up some local produce, such as fresh fish from Seabourne Fish in the town, or something yummy from Baileys Country Store farm shop.
While there isn't any parking at Little Blue you can drive down the narrow street (only suitable for small and medium-sized cars) and stop outside to unload your luggage. There is on street parking in Penryn or a car park only 200 yards from the house.

cottage.name: Chy Goff
cottage.introText:
Set down a Cornish country lane, detached Chy Goff is a pretty stone cottage that sits perfectly in tune with its surroundings. Steps lead down to the garden and entrance; inside, it's full of simple charm and home-from-home informality.
Character exudes from the slate-flagged floors and beamed ceilings, a green Aga complementing the rustic feel. The kitchen leads to the sitting/dining-room, which has a multi-burner, satellite TV from which you can access your Netflix account and French doors opening out to the sheltered garden.
From the sitting/dining-room, a step takes you to a small study and a shower-room. Traditional cottage stairs lead to the bedrooms and bathroom, which enjoy countryside views. Outside, the small garden has a little stream, and extends to a rear patio that catches the evening sun.

cottage.name: Pippin
cottage.introText:
A truly romantic getaway tucked in the corner of a luscious meadow with exclusive sea views; this fabulous shepherd's hut really is the ultimate destination.
Nestled in the beautiful countryside in a dreamy location, with only the wildlife as your neighbours and a quiet tidal beach only moments away, you will not want to leave Pippin's warm and welcoming arms.
As you approach your destination through verdant lanes in this Outstanding Area of Natural Beauty you will feel like a true traveller, which is the meaning of Pippin. As you leave your car in the charming old quarry and walk up through the wildflower meadow you will see Pippin awaiting your arrival and the view over the tranquil estuary open up in front of you.
This truly unique and private location really has all you need; bask in the morning sun with your morning coffee on the hand-carved love seat after your morning dip or take a perch on the steps perhaps. There is a fabulous fire-pit perfectly set up for two, where you can enjoy a true fire cooked meal or perhaps toast your marshmallows and gaze at the stars together. The meadow provides plenty of space and is a great spot to have a picnic in the gentle summer sunshine. This is the perfect place for your four-legged friends to run free too but please be aware at certain times of year there are cattle in the other half of the meadow - this will be fenced off but please take care.
Inside this charming hut there is ultimate comfort - sink into the cosy double bed with only the rustling trees to lull you to sleep, the bench seat provides the perfect spot to sit and look at the view on the cooler days but fear not as there is a little wood-burner to ensure you are kept toasty at any time of year. Luxury has not gone amiss with of course an en suite loo and shower at Pippin.

cottage.name: Tea By The Sea
cottage.introText:
Less than a minute's stroll from the sea, this characterful two-storey apartment offers a wonderfully laid-back base for exploring Cadgwith, the picturesque little fishing cove that it sits in the heart of.
Step inside and you'll find a practical ground floor with a twin bedroom, a cosy single and the family bathroom. Upstairs, you are welcomed in by a beautiful light and open plan living space which makes the most of its elevated position with a lovely large window and sights of the sea framed between the historic cottages of the courtyard. The sitting and dining area is ideal for relaxing in after a day by the coast. The cosy well-equipped kitchen is perfect for preparing simple evening meals, while a welcoming king-size bedroom completes the first floor accommodation.
What truly sets this home apart is its location. Just outside the front door, you can hire a kayak and set off on an adventure across the bay or just relax by the water's edge where fishing boats bob on the water and the pub welcomes you with hearty food and local ale.

cottage.name: The Pigsty
cottage.introText:
Countryside charm and vintage elegance rolled into one, The Pigsty is a perfect romantic getaway or retreat for a little family holiday as it sleeps up to three lucky guests. The Pigsty is a spacious, luxury bolthole and oozes effortless style and comfort from the moment you walk inside; it's set in a cluster of similar barns and snuggled at the end of a sheltered lane just outside the sleepy hamlet of St Levan.
Arrive and walk down the charming little path, taking in the stunning countryside that surrounds you. Walk into the spacious kitchen with its Belfast sink and oak work surfaces, hang your coats on the coat pegs beside the door and instantly relax. The sitting-room is flooded with light and has a comfy sofa and pre-loved rocking chair basking in the toasty warmth of the wood-burner so you can stretch out after a day walking the coastal footpaths or exploring the many art galleries in west Cornwall.
A charming antique dining-table and wooden chairs nestle between the sofas and kitchen, perfect for long lunches and laid back intimate suppers.
The Pigsty has just the one family bedroom with an elegant mix of old and new, this bright and light room houses a comfy double bed and day bed (perfect for a younger child). There's a delightful shower-room to wake you up in the morning or to cool down after a day out exploring.
Stable-doors lead out from the open plan living-room onto the gorgeous, enclosed patio, sheltered by an old Cornish hedge. Overlooking fields where you may spot the odd cow or sheep (as The Pigsty is located on a working farm) this is the perfect spot for a pre-dinner G&T.

cottage.name: Littlecott
cottage.introText:
Littlecott is an ideal bolthole for exploring all the delights in and around Boscastle. The accommodation is very comfortable (and includes a king-size bed), bright and light with a fresh contemporary feel, and has beautiful elevated views out across the village which are a treat for the eyes.
Snuggled next to the friendly yet discreet owners' home, it is only a short walk down the steep hill into the heart of the picturesque harbour and you will be able to spend hours just relaxing, eating and exploring this charming and historical village.
Littlecott is a walker's paradise; the walks direct from the doorway lead you straight out onto the coastal path where miles of coastline may be explored.

cottage.name: 1 North Parade
cottage.introText:
This is a gorgeous little bolthole, right in the middle of lovely Portscatho on the Roseland peninsula and just yards from Tatam's beach (and Tatam's boutique cafe selling delicious coffee, croissants and cakes).
Beautifully decorated and wonderfully comfortable, 1 North Parade will delight all who stay. Local artwork, rugs, cushions and throws all add to the feel good factor and together with the warming wood-burner make the cottage as inviting in cooler months as it is in spring and summer.
There are glorious coastal walks right from the doorstep, with Tatam's beach a few steps away and the renowned Hidden Hut cafe at Porthcurnick Beach just a seven minute walk along the coast.
The nearby Plume of Feathers serves great locally-sourced food and offers a blazing log fire in chilly months, the perfect way to end the day.
This terraced cottage has a ground floor bedroom with hints of quirky nautical style in the porthole windowed doors and canvas sail used as a room divider. The shower-room has a big walk-in shower, Moroccan tiles and a useful drying/dressing-area. Upstairs, the open plan living-room is light and airy with painted floorboards, a warming wood-burner and an antique pine dining-table and pew.
The galley kitchen has Shaker-style units, oak work surfaces and lots of little extras like cookery books for those who like a spot of holiday cooking, along with a Nespresso coffee machine (please bring your own pods). A bespoke hamper awaits your arrival with Cornish tea and coffee, Cornish biscuits, Rodda's milk and butter, St Mawes' hens eggs and a fresh loaf of bread.

cottage.name: Ivor's Barn
cottage.introText:
Ivor's Barn is a gorgeous stone-built barn perched on a hillside above the small village of Gulval in the far west of Cornwall. Restful rural surroundings with an ancient village, castle and sea close by… that's the lovely little mix you'll find at this charming abode. Sleeping four, this rather lovely barn is a wonderful choice for a family getaway or a romantic holiday for two, and your favourite pooch is more than welcome to join you!
This gorgeous barn offers reverse level accommodation to take full advantage of the countryside and distant sea views. Arrive and walk into the spacious hallway hang your coats on the coat pegs and relax. Take the stairs up to the open plan living area. The fabulous kitchen has everything you might need for cooking up a breakfast feast or preparing a picnic to take with you to the beach. Relax at the breakfast-bar with your morning coffee and enjoy long, lazy lunches and sociable suppers at the dining-table. The sitting-area is flooded with light and has two comfy sofas basking in the toasty warmth of the wood-burner so you can stretch out after a day walking the St Michaels Way or coastal footpaths or exploring the little shops in St Ives.
On the ground floor you will find two bedrooms that wouldn't look out of place in a boutique hotel. No expense has been spared, and the lovely owner has made sure that you have the best night's sleep, with each bed adorned in luxury linens and locally sourced natural throws. The contemporary family shower-room has a wonderful shower which is perfect for washing away salty hair and sandy toes. You will also find the oh so handy washing machine on this floor too.
Outside, there's a private patio which is stepped in places and perfect for soaking up the sunshine during the day, al fresco dining and gathering around the fire-pit at night under the starlit sky.

cottage.name: Smugglers Cottage
cottage.introText:
A cosy rural retreat for two on the edge of the National Trust’s beautiful Penrose Estate, Smugglers Cottage nestles quietly beside a handful of similar stone dwellings in a truly peaceful setting at the end of a private unmade lane.
After each day’s adventure, the living-room's big squashy sofa will invite you to lounge in front of the wood-burner. Stairs lead to the pretty bedroom and the bathroom, which has a step up to the bath.
Outside is a private enclosed terraced garden, and a few yards away there is a picnic table in the grassed parking enclosure – perfectly placed for sunset watching or dining al fresco alongside horses grazing quietly in the nearby fields. RNAS Culdrose provides some entertainment with helicopters occasionally flying nearby, and the historic town of Helston provides all essential amenities.

cottage.name: Cuddle Cabin
cottage.introText:
**£100 off any week-long booking between 31st October 2025 - 5th December 2025. Please use code SALE100 when booking.**
Just as the name suggests this cabin is a perfect spot for a romantic weekend for two. Hidden away in a secluded corner of the owners' smallholding with just the chickens for company and the nature of the Cornish countryside.
Cuddle Cabin is found down a tree-lined path where, when you spot your hideaway, you will see a large outdoor seating area which is a wonderful place to relax. Enjoy a refreshing glass of champagne in the early evening glow or perhaps watch for shooting stars on a winter's eve whilst toasting marshmallows on the fire-pit.
Inside this cosy cabin you will see that no detail has gone amiss; a squishy L-shaped sofa is perfect to snuggle up on in front of the fire or enjoy a good film. The kitchen has everything you might need for a tasty meal or perhaps enjoy exploring this rural part of Cornwall and see what hidden culinary treasures you might find. The calming bedroom has a luxurious dressing-room to keep the bedroom as tranquil as possible and of course an en suite shower-room. Both the living space and bedroom have double doors that open onto your decking, enjoy wandering out in your fluffy dressing gown with your morning coffee and listening to the birds.

cottage.name: The Sheep Shed
cottage.introText:
The Sheep Shed is a delightful bolthole for couples, ideal for those who want to get away from the stresses of everyday life. Lovingly converted by the owners, this former farm building provides a great base for exploring this beautiful area of Cornwall and gives easy access to the beaches and attractions on the north, south and west coasts.
Set on a rural small holding, this cute barn is completely detached, set apart from the owners' farmhouse and is only a short drive from the nearby village of Stithians and an even shorter drive to the local pub. The large open plan living space has patio doors that open onto a private garden with stunning views across the surrounding countryside, where the owners' flock of sheep can sometimes be seen grazing.
The light bedroom and en suite bathroom are up three steps, here you can sit in bed with your morning tea looking out at the views.
Babes in arms up to 12 months old are welcome at The Sheep Shed.

cottage.name: The Haven
cottage.introText:
In the peaceful country hamlet of Trewalder, just a short drive from the wild cliffs and sandy beaches of the north Cornish coast and the fishing village of Port Isaac of 'Doc Martin' fame, The Haven is a delightful, immaculately presented, detached property with beamed ceilings downstairs and stripped pine doors in most rooms.
The spacious kitchen/diner is very well-equipped, and has doors that lead out to the sunny patio and large enclosed garden, which is ideal for young children. The sitting-room has soft, comfortable furnishings and a wood-burner effect electric stove set in a striking fireplace. Colourful linens and curtains complement the polished wood floors of the bedrooms, one of which is on the ground floor.

cottage.name: The Boatshed
cottage.introText:
Wow! This beautifully appointed former boatshed is stunning, with reverse level living making the most of the wonderful views and, of course, the sunsets.
Set in a secluded spot at the end of a private lane surrounded by fields and with far reaching views to the sea, this gorgeous getaway is perfect for a relaxing break as it is set apart from the owners' cottage, while they are close enough to provide advice on local cafes, restaurants and other amenities (kayak/SUP hire, surfing, boat trips to name but a few).
Cross your private south-facing terrace and enter the kitchen/dining-area. The bedroom is also on this ground floor level; accessed via a fantastic industrial sliding door, made with original Georgian timbers, and ta-dah here's your comfortable king-size bed. Slip in between the luxury cotton sheets and…sweet dreams… The shower-room on the ground floor is equally as fabulous, with a double walk-in shower and unique Scandinavian towel rail and stone wash-basin.
Nordic style is synonymous to The Boatshed, every thought has gone into making this abode unique and styled with flair. The sitting-room on the first floor has a floor to ceiling, west-facing window; the sunsets are stunning and with a fabulous contemporary fire you can snuggle up in the warmth. No curtains are necessary in this first floor room as you are not overlooked and the light floods in. Take in the lovely views, there's even a distant sea view towards Prussia Cove and on a clear day Mount's Bay too. At night enjoy the clear west Cornwall skies and occasionally the Milky Way.
Set within the grounds of the owners' home, close to the coast, The Boatshed is perfect for guests looking to explore the South West Coast Path or bathers who prefer quiet coves for swimming. Leave your car as there is a footpath from your doorstep to Kenneggy Cove, if you head east you will reach Praa Sands and, further on, Rinsey. Head west and you will pass Prussia Cove; if you fancy a good stomp, carry on past Cudden Point to Marazion and St Michael's Mount.

cottage.name: 7 Chapel Street
cottage.introText:
Tucked away in the heart of the historic fishing village of Mousehole, 7 Chapel Street is a sweet two bedroom cottage offering a perfect coastal escape. Brimming with charm, the cottage sits on one of the village's enchanting, cobbled streets, still walked by fishermen and once whispered through by smugglers of old. Just a minute's stroll leads you to the picture perfect harbour where morning swims in calm waters are a beloved ritual.
The owner, Steve Deeks, an established racing driver who has coached and mentored FI champions, became enchanted with the village and its stories from the sailors and fishermen and set up this delightful home surrounded by the light and energy he loves about the village.
Step inside to find a welcoming open plan living and dining area thoughtfully designed to make the most of the cosy space giving a relaxed coastal feel. A huge wood-burner sits proudly in the heart of the room, radiating warmth hrough the whole cottage on chillier evenings, sink back into the sofas and curl up with a book or share your day's adventures over a glass of wine. The kitchen is a delightful mix of charm and practicality. Whether cooking up a hearty breakfast or a romantic supper, this kitchen is a social space which invites you to cook with ease.
A king-size bedroom on this floor offers a restful retreat with luxurious linens and down the stairs the lower ground floor reveals a sweet single bedroom and family bathroom complete with a bath and fitted overhead shower, ideal after a day exploring the Cornish coastline.
Outside, a shared courtyard with bistro-style table and chairs provides a sunny spot to sit back and unwind with a glass of something chilled. A friendly pub lies just a stone's throw away and an excellent delicatessen is just around the corner, pick up your picnic treats and head to the beach for the day. For an unforgettable dining experience, be sure to book at a table at the renowned 2 Duke Street where celebrated chefs serve up exquisite seasonal dishes using the finest local produce in a relaxed and stylish setting. This cottage is a place to slow down, breathe in the sea air and soak up the timeless magic of Mousehole.
Parking is in one of the public car parks in the village approximately 200 yards from the property.

cottage.name: Willow Cottage
cottage.introText:
**£100 off any week-long booking between 31st October 2025 - 5th December 2025. Please use code SALE100 when booking.**
This idyllic hideaway is set in a tranquil country location, nestled in the owners' smallholding, in the romantic Helford area. Willow Cottage is a beautiful retreat for two (and your four-legged friend) and is ideal for both a relaxing week or weekend getaway.
There is plenty of space but it is ever so cosy. The minute you enter through the entrance hall into the beautifully furnished open plan living space with its charming wood-burner and high ceilings you will feel right at home. Willow Cottage has been thoughtfully designed for comfortable living; the large kitchen has a splendid island for food prep or where your loved one can perch with a glass of wine while supper is being prepared, even the views from the kitchen sink overlooking wooded valleys are to die for. The large sofa is perfect for snuggling up together; a perfect place to enjoy a hot cup of coffee from the Nespresso machine or perhaps relaxing with a good book in front of the wood-burner. The sitting area opens up to a lovely patio just for you, hide away from the world with only the owners' back garden and the birds nearby.
The fabulous bedroom has luxurious crisp sheets where you will drift off into a peaceful slumber. The bathroom has a wonderful roll-top bath for two - immerse yourself in the bubbles and let your aches and pains ebb away in the tub or if you prefer a shower there is a large shower to soak yourself under.
Tucked away down a private lane, this gorgeous rural property shares its location with the owners and [Cuddle Cabin (3959)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-3959.html "Cuddle Cabin") however there is plenty of space from one another.

cottage.name: Lowenna
cottage.introText:
Perched on the stunning Coverack Headland, Lowenna is a charming and elegant second-floor apartment situated in one of the most gorgeous locations within the Lizard Peninsula.
The name "Lowenna" means joy, happiness and bliss in Cornish, which sums up exactly how you'll feel staying here. Step straight onto the South West Coast Path from the private communal gardens, where scenic cliffside walks lead to a beautiful sandy cove. The apartment sits within the grounds of the former Headland Hotel, giving guests access to peaceful surroundings with stunning oceanic views, a tennis court, and woodland to explore.
