Mears Beach is a short walk away. Please note, Lowenna is on the second floor, there's no lift.
Inside, the open plan living space is bright and airy, offering a real sense of calm, the moment you walk in. Large windows let lots of beautiful light in, making it the perfect spot to unwind. After a day of exploring, sink into the Chesterfield sofa with a glass of wine, after rustling up some holiday treats in the well-equipped kitchen and do bring along your Fire Stick for streaming your favourite TV programme if you can draw yourself away from the wonderful sea views.
The king-size bedroom is decorated in soft, calming tones and offers glimpses of the sea, a dreamy setting for a romantic break. Across the hall, the modern bathroom has a lovely deep bath, perfect for a long soak after a day out swimming in the Atlantic, bird watching, hiking or diving!

cottage.name: Trelowth Chapel
cottage.introText:
Close to the picturesque fishing harbour at Mevagissey and the wonders of Heligan Gardens, this utterly delightful semi-detached chapel conversion is a wonderful example of thoughtful and skilled craftmanship. Attention to detail is evident at every turn, all topped off by superb quality fittings and furnishings offering every comfort you could wish.
The impressive living space on the ground floor, filled with light from soaring arched windows, accesses an inner hallway with a big family bathroom and thickly-carpeted stairs which lead up to the en suite bedroom and twin bedroom above.
A paved courtyard outside is sheltered by high fences and provides the ideal place for a morning coffee or evening meal on warm summer days. Set on the edge of a small village and with beaches, fishing harbours and coastal footpaths just a couple of miles away, this is the perfect holiday location.

cottage.name: Potters Cottage
cottage.introText:
In the heart of Mousehole and within walking distance from the bustling harbour, this stunning dog-friendly cottage is simply charming and offers a wonderful seaside escape. Potters Cottage is tucked away in a secluded spot (shared with two other cottages) reached via a little cobbled lane.
Elegantly furnished Potters Cottage is a gorgeous retreat, perfect for a family, two couples or an intimate love nest for two. Once an old Pilchard Press, it has recently been lovingly refurbished to offer a chic and cosy bolthole for five lucky guests. Two traditional granite steps lead down to the characterful stable-door and straight into the impressive open plan living area which is packed with features. Sink into the cosy sofas and instantly switch off from the stresses and strains of everyday life.
The kitchen is well-equipped with everything you need to create those fabulous holiday breakfasts or lazy evening suppers. Plan your days out whilst gathering to enjoy delicious food; the stable-door can be opened wide on balmy summer evenings if you fancy a spot of al fresco dining in the sunshine.
Heading up the super-snug stairs you will find two double bedrooms and a single bedroom, all furnished with wonderfully comfy beds, crisp white linens, heritage radiators, lovely throws and plentiful cushions - you are guaranteed a relaxing night's slumber at Potters Cottage. The contemporary family bathroom is also located on this floor, with a bath and fitted shower.
Outside the property there is a shared courtyard area, where you can enjoy a spot of lunch in the sunshine or a cocktail before heading into Mousehole for a bite to eat.
Potters Cottage is a wonderful blend of old and new with all mod-cons taken care of within the stylish interior.

cottage.name: River View Terrace
cottage.introText:
Come and treat yourself to a wonderful holiday in the peaceful creekside village of Golant on the banks of the River Fowey. With the most gorgeous views of the tidal waters over to the ancient woodland beyond that will have you mesmerised from the minute you arrive, River View Terrace certainly lives up to its name. It's a water lover's paradise and a fabulous year-round retreat to explore what has to be one of the prettiest parts of Cornwall.
Spend your days kayaking and paddle-boarding up the river, strolling along the riverbanks through ancient woodland, soaking up the sailing scene in nearby Fowey or simply kicking back on the terrace drinking in those glorious views. Holidays don't get don't much better than this.
Enjoying a prime elevated position, this mid-terrace retreat, has cosy and comfortable interiors creating a delightful home-from-home atmosphere. The living accommodation sits on the ground floor and the large bay window in the sitting-room perfectly frames the marvellous views, so if the weather is a little temperamental you can seek refuge inside and still enjoy the wonderful surroundings. Conjure up culinary delights with the best local produce in the kitchen/dining-room, best served up in the terraced garden with those breathtaking views creating the perfect backdrop. There are three bedrooms set over two floors, each floor having its own bathing facilities, offering a degree of privacy. Lazy holiday lie-ins will definitely be the order of the day in bedroom one, as waking up to that view will make it difficult to get out of bed, so breakfast in bed is a must!
Please be advised that due to its charming village location, access to Golant and River View Terrace is narrow, when accessing the property there is a steep hill with a narrow section between two granite posts (7.5ft width).
Although children under 8 are regrettably not accepted at this property, babies up to six months are welcome.

cottage.name: Guillemot
cottage.introText:
Just a stone's throw from beautiful Gyllyngvase beach and its renowned cafe/restaurant and a short stroll away from the delights of Falmouth town, Guillemot is a fantastic choice for a fun-filled, coastal holiday. Perfect for two (and your little dog), this charming retreat has been thoughtfully furnished - allowing you to slip into holiday mode as soon as you arrive. Its location is rather special too, ideal for coast path adventures, trying out kayaking, canoeing or a windsurfing lesson from the beach, or simply enjoying a restful escape by the sea.
Guillemot is adjoined to the owners' house but has plenty of privacy and is accessed via your own private front door. The entrance hall leads to the light-filled, open plan living space, where you will find the stylish kitchen - well-equipped with high quality appliances, including a Bosch coffee machine. Perfect for your morning coffee! Perch at the breakfast-bar and enjoy a leisurely breakfast before you head out for the day's adventures, and if you wish to relax for a little while, the living area has a comfortable sofa and a Smart TV.
The king-size bedroom is decorated in beautifully bright colours, perfectly complementing your coastal location. Here you'll find a TV, plenty of storage space and an en suite shower-room to wash off sandy toes at the end of the day. Outside, there is a lovely, enclosed courtyard at the front of the property - just the spot for a sundowner after strolling back from the beach.

cottage.name: Tree Tops Cabin
cottage.introText:
Looking for the perfect get-away-from-it-all retreat? Look no further! Tree Tops Cabin is that and so much more, sat high up in the trees with a peaceful stream trickling through below, it has a real rural feel yet is only a few hundred yards from the sea, beach and friendly local pub in the idyllic Cornish fishing village of Cadgwith.
Step inside and you will immediately feel at home, every single detail has been thoughtfully put together and provided, with a calming colour scheme of soft greys and whites. This true hideaway has everything you could need for a comfortable break away from the everyday, complete with super-comfy king-size bed (facing the floor-to-ceiling windows, so you can enjoy a morning cuppa in bed whilst taking in the view - bliss!), snuggly sofa and toasty wood-burner (ensuring cosiness out-of-season). There's also a delightful kitchen-area tucked away at the far end of the cabin, featuring a mini oven with two-ring hob, fridge, kettle and toaster, sweet dining-area, where you can enjoy a scrumptious supper whilst also taking in the relaxing view, and, last but not least, stylish shower-room.
Outside, the raised deck provides the ideal place to sit back, relax (perhaps with a good book and a glass of your favourite tipple), take in the fresh air and enjoy the tranquil treetop view, all with the calming sound of the stream below and birds chirping nearby. Why not dine al fresco of an evening or, if you don't feel like cooking, head to the welcoming local pub, serving delicious locally-sourced food including fresh seafood sourced from the cove, just a short walk away. The friendly but unobtrusive owners live in the neighbouring cottage, so are on-hand if you need a local's advice or have any questions.
Arguably the most picturesque village on the Lizard peninsula and still a thriving fishing community, friendly Cadgwith also boasts a restaurant, gift and craft shop and freshly caught fish for sale right on the cove. Nearby Ruan Minor has a handy convenience shop as well as the Treleague Dairy farm shop, where you can buy their locally-sourced produce including clotted cream, eggs and fresh milk. You may never want to leave this lovely place, however, if you can bear to tear yourselves away, there is plenty to see and do within easy reach.
If you want to explore by foot, the South West Coast Path, along the dramatic coastline with breathtaking coastal views, is right on your doorstep. For beach days, Kennack Sands (a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty) is just a couple of miles away - well-known amongst the surfing community for its good-sized waves and great for walking your four-legged friend too (the east side is dog-friendly all year-round).
Within a short drive are picturesque Kynance Cove, the village of Mullion (with its old smugglers' coves, local shops, pubs and restaurants), Poldhu Cove (the place to stop for a luxury hot chocolate!), the Lizard (where you can enjoy folk music, sea shanties or jazz at the local pub) and the picturesque Helford River. If you fancy giving some water sports a try, surfing, kayaking, paddle-boarding and windsurfing are all available locally too (if you want to bring your own kayaks, surfboards, bikes etc these can be stored under the cabin).
All in all, Tree Tops Cabin provides a place where you can relax, recharge and enjoy some quality time together in one of the most beautiful parts of Cornwall.

cottage.name: 3 Harbour Court
cottage.introText:
Welcome to 3 Harbour Court, a stylish bijou first floor apartment perfectly placed in the beating heart of Portscatho village and just a stone's throw from the pretty harbour, scenic coast path and stunning beaches of the Roseland peninsula.
Portscatho has all you need for the perfect holiday and 3 Harbour Court has everything virtually on the doorstep. With a lovely selection of traditional village shops, eateries and cafes you may never need to take your car out but if you do decide to travel further afield the delights of Cornwall await.
Conveniently tucked away off the main street in Portscatho, 3 Harbour Court can be found just behind the harbour. Tatams, which serves freshly brewed coffee alongside a great selection of gorgeous pastries, can be found just around the corner on the harbour wall (the perfect start to the day), and Tide & Thyme - a cafe and takeaway is just next door so that's breakfast, lunch and dinner all taken care of and just moments away!
Access is shared with one other apartment with key entry to the door at the bottom of the stairs which split at the top. The left-hand staircase leads to 3 Harbour Court and the door leads into the open plan living area. Light, bright and welcoming, the stylish interior has been cleverly designed to make the most of the space and those memorising sea views. The sitting-area has a comfy sofa and armchair, perfect for gazing out to sea. A breakfast-bar sits in-between the sitting-area and kitchen, making the most of the views and giving you a bird's eye view over the roof tops to the harbour. The kitchen has all the equipment you will need to whip up a holiday meal and of course the dishwasher will take care of the washing up!
Outside the kitchen a door leads onto a small balcony with just enough space for two. This little spot is the perfect place to sit and drink in the view or perhaps catch up on some holiday reading to the sound of the sea gently lapping against the seawall.
The bedroom is delightful, decorated in whites and blues - a nod to the nautical location. White plantation shutters give this room a Mediterranean vibe and a great night's sleep is assured in the super-king size bed. The shower-room is perfect after a busy day out and about. Parking is available in the village square but there are time restrictions, so it is recommended that you park a short walk away in New Road pay and display car park.
Whether you are looking for a romantic bolthole or simply looking for some time out in a quaint Cornish village, 3 Harbour Court has all the ingredients for the perfect getaway.

cottage.name: Oyster Cottage
cottage.introText:
Oyster Cottage provides unexpectedly spacious and peaceful accommodation, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Mevagissey's historic centre but just a three minute level walk from the harbourside. The end cottage of a modern terrace of five, there is a large, enclosed garden and private parking for a medium-sized car, an unexpected bonus in such a small village although beware of the narrow entrance.
This is a delightfully scenic village with narrow lanes of colourful terraced cottages crowding the hillsides around the sheltered harbour below. Fishermen still mend their nets on the harbourside and offer boat trips to visitors, and there are craft shops, tea-rooms and old smugglers' pubs to explore on dry land. Having negotiated the narrow winding streets, Oyster Cottage is a lovely holiday destination.

cottage.name: Fisherton Cottage at Poughill
cottage.introText:
Situated in the pretty village of Poughill, on the road to Northcott Mouth Beach, you will find this delightful holiday abode. Perfectly placed for the fabulous beaches of Bude, with the quaint fishing villages of Boscastle and Port Isaac just a short drive away and a pub in the village, you really have found the perfect holiday cottage, you can even walk to Crooklets beach with your four-legged friend or venture to the shops all being 30 minutes away by foot.
With oodles of charm and character, you will feel instantly at home from the moment you arrive here. The ground floor is home to a cosy sitting-room, where you will find a warming wood-burner for cooler months and a comfy sofa where you can snuggle up in front of the Smart TV. The separate dining-room has traditional slate floors and a fabulous original ornamental range, which wouldn't look out of place in Downton Abbey! Throughout the house you will find some gorgeous pieces of traditional furniture, like the dresser complete with pretty crockery and the beautiful, tiled floor in the hallway. In the kitchen you will find all the equipment you'll need to cook a holiday meal, including the all-important dishwasher and access to the garden, where you can wander out and enjoy your morning cuppa in the fresh air or enjoy a perfect sundowner after a day of holiday fun.
Climb the stairs and you will find three pretty bedrooms and the family bathroom. Bedroom one has a lovely outlook and with 'zip and link' beds, gives you the luxury to choose either a super-king double bed or twins. Bedroom two is a double bedroom overlooking the back garden and bedroom three has a single bed, ideal for either a child or adult. The family bathroom on the first floor has a bath with shower over.
Outside, a pretty cottage garden awaits, perfect for al fresco dining in the Cornish sunshine and of course your four-legged friend can join you too.
Being a traditional terraced Cornish cottage, the free village car park can be found 100 yards from the front door, however, on arrival you can pull in just past the row of cottages and unload your suitcases.

cottage.name: Mount Wise Farmhouse
cottage.introText:
Nestled in the heart of Cornwall, this remarkable 400 year old farmhouse is more than just a holiday cottage, it's an experience. From the moment you arrive, you're greeted by the enchanting beauty of its lovingly tended garden, which provides the perfect backdrop for your stay. The real welcome begins when you step inside, where the owner's exceptional homemade bread and cake await, together with very thoughtful welcome treats and surprises to make you feel instantly at home. Accommodating six lucky guests (but offering a reduction at certain times of year for smaller parties) and two, four-legged friends are most welcome too.
At the heart of this home is a kitchen that any food lover would envy. So practical in its design and quality, it features a twin-oven electric Rangemaster, honed granite worktops, and a timeless double Belfast sink. Whether you're whipping up a simple breakfast or preparing a feast for family and friends, this space is designed to inspire. The large dining-table seats eight which is convenient if you are a larger party and it's the perfect space for gathering and sharing stories of the day's adventures. (You can also book neighbouring property [Mount Wise Cottage (2187)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-2187.html "Mount Wise Cottage") that sleeps two, for even more family fun). **Why not book both properties together (sleeping 8 in total) for an extra special 2025 Christmas celebration and receive a festive 20% discount off each property.**
The farmhouse's charm is evident in every corner, from its thick granite walls to its original fireplaces. The cosy sitting-room invites you to relax by the wood-burning stove, while the beautifully decorated bedrooms offer peaceful havens for restful nights. Each space has been thoughtfully arranged by the owner (who lives nearby) to balance historic character with modern comfort, creating a truly special place to unwind.

cottage.name: Scenic Bay
cottage.introText:
Scenic Bay is a dream, set in a spacious meadow with a stunning view to match its name. This pretty pod is beautifully finished and kitted out for all of your holiday needs. There is under-floor heating, making it wonderfully toasty whatever the time of year, and a heated towel rail too, ideal for drying those beach towels. The well-equipped kitchen area includes a sink, cooker, microwave, fridge and kettle, and there is even a TV provided - perfect for cosy nights in. The sofa, which converts with ease into a double bed, is the ideal spot for relaxing with a book or enjoying the view and there is a comfy double bed at the back of the pod too. The modern shower-room includes hot and cold running water and a proper flushing loo - luxury glamping at its best!
Many an hour can be spent outside here too, enjoying quality time together in the picture-perfect surroundings - the panoramic vista runs from the Lizard peninsula in the east, with majestic St Michael's Mount in the middle to Mousehole in the west. Why not cook up a scrummy supper on the fire-pit barbecue and dine al fresco on the deck, drinking in the ever-changing view. Also snuggled into this spacious meadow are [Coastal Gaze](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4063.html "Coastal Gaze") and [Mount Lookout](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4064.html "Mount Lookout") - Scenic Bay is the first of the three and each have their own private areas.

cottage.name: Coastal Gaze
cottage.introText:
This beautifully situated pod has outstanding 180 degree views across Mount's Bay, running from the Lizard peninsula in the east, with majestic St Michael's Mount in the middle to Mousehole in the west. Coastal Gaze is a special retreat that you will want to return to time and time again. Wonderfully styled inside, every detail and item has been thoughtfully put together and provided.
The well-equipped kitchen area is complete with a cooker, microwave, fridge and kettle (cuppa, anyone?), and there is even a TV - ideal for cosy nights in. The cleverly-designed sofa converts to a double bed with ease and there is a comfy double bed at the back of the pod too. The under-floor heating will keep you toasty whatever the weather and there is, of course, a stylish en suite shower-room complete with hot and cold running water, flushing loo and heated towel rail.
But that's not all, outside you can snooze in the sun, dine al fresco on the deck, cook up a storm (or toast some marshmallows!) on the fire-pit barbecue until your heart's content. Also snuggled into this spacious meadow are [Scenic Bay](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4062.html "Scenic Bay") and [Mount Lookout](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4064.html "Mount Lookout") - Coastal Gaze is the middle of the three and each have their own private areas.

cottage.name: The Pilchard Shed
cottage.introText:
Just a stone's throw away from the vibrant harbourside in the magical Roseland village of St Mawes, The Pilchard Shed is an oh so cute hideaway, tucked up a cobbled pathway and perfect for a romantic getaway or a solo retreat. From the moment you arrive on the Roseland Peninsula you will feel yourself relax into your holiday. Beautiful countryside and wooded valleys offer glimpses of the sea which culminate in a panoramic seascape when you arrive in charming St Mawes.
The Pilchard Shed could not be more centrally located, up a tiny, cobbled alley from the harbour. This gorgeous bijou abode has been cleverly crafted to optimise the small but perfectly formed space and from the moment you arrive you will be captivated. The cosy seating has a seaside theme, beautifully furnished in blue hues to match the location. A dining-table folds away and hangs on the wall when you don't need it, optimising the living space. Above the built-in seating, a gorgeous king-size cabin bed awaits up a ladder (please take care and mind your head) and the clever use of space continues with built in cupboards underneath.
The tiny galley kitchen packs a big punch with a combination microwave and fridge with small freezer compartment, perfect for ice cubes for your evening aperitif! The shower-room is through the kitchen, beautifully finished with fabulous mosaic tiles. Whilst there is no TV or outside space at The Pilchard Shed, the colourful harbourside is just moments away, so why not take your morning coffee or evening aperitif down the cobbled footpath and sit by the water's edge to watch the boats sail by, the perfect dreamy holiday pastime!
For larger parties or groups of friends why not book neighbouring [Manor Cottage (4988)]( https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4988.html "Manor Cottage") alongside The Pilchard Shed.

cottage.name: Puffin
cottage.introText:
Set on the cliffs surrounding stunning coastline, Puffin is found at the centre of the cluster of houses on the headland in the foreground which sits between the beaches of Porth and Lusty Glaze. Enjoy listening to the crashing waves on the shore as you sip a drink on the balcony of this mid-terraced house or wander over the headland to watch the most fabulous sunsets.
Opening the front door to the entrance hall you are greeted by a light and bright property; take the stairs up to the open plan living space which is subtly furnished in coastal soft greys and yellows. You can enjoy glimpses of the sea from the sitting-area window and keep the windows open and listen to the crashing waves. The large sofas are perfect for you all to kick back and relax together after a day on the beach, remember to bring your login details for streaming services on the Smart TV. The dining-area looks out to the private balcony where you can sit in the sun with your morning coffee and admire the view. The kitchen is compact, however equipped to a good standard with all you may need to cook up something rather special.
Take the stairs down to the ground floor; here you will find three double bedrooms and family shower-room along with access to the outside area. The principal bedroom has a comfy double bed and of course a fabulous en suite shower-room along with patio doors that open to your private decked area and shared grassy lawn. Bedroom two has 'zip and link' beds to provide flexibility for your party and an extra child can be accommodated on a fold out bed. This bedroom also has patio doors leading onto a decked area. Bedroom three is tucked away at the back of the house and has a lovely double bed, there is a family shower-room on this floor too.
The outside space at Puffin is lovely, you have a private balcony on the first floor with side views down to the beach where you can enjoy the sunshine and a coffee. If you want space for everyone to be together enjoy your own decked area with a picnic bench which leads to the shared lawn area which is shared by the properties in the row with lovely sea views and perfect for the dog to have a run around or the kids to kick a football. Puffin boasts its own private mid tide access to Porth Beach and just a moment’s stroll from the popular Lusty Glaze beach with its fabulous restaurant.
Puffin is situated within the grounds of the Glendorgal Hotel, with around 17 acres of private (and gated) headland. This attractive property sits in a quiet cul-de-sac of purpose-built holiday homes.

cottage.name: Pedney
cottage.introText:
Hidden away in a sweet hamlet in magical far west Cornwall, Pedney is an idyllic, dog-friendly shepherd's hut for two. If you're looking to escape to a tranquil hideaway, within easy reach of the beautiful Cornish coastline, this is just the place…
Tucked away amongst a subtropical garden, Pedney's wonderfully rustic interiors are sure to charm you. The beautiful hand-crafted kitchen comes complete with all the essentials for rustling up simple meals, with a wooden dining table and chairs, cosy wood-burner and a sweet seating area. At the other end of the hut, you'll find a sumptuous double bed, ideal for those leisurely lie ins, and stylish en suite shower-room. Pedney's blissful, laid-back vibe invites you to leave your worries behind and relax for a little while - you're on holiday after all!
With its delightful sub-tropical plants and flowers, the serene and secluded outside space is the perfect spot too for blissful days unwinding under the Cornish sunshine. There are two cute outdoor seating areas here, ideal for lazy al fresco breakfasts or an evening tipple after a day spent exploring the coastline.

cottage.name: Porth Chapel Cabin
cottage.introText:
Far West Cornwall is renowned for its glorious golden sandy beaches, hidden coves and idyllic countryside, stretching as far as the eye can see. Porth Chapel Cabin is an enchanting romantic bolthole, hidden away in a sub-tropical paradise and just a short journey away from the delights of St Ives and Mousehole.
Deep in the beating heart of west Cornwall, Porth Chapel Cabin is a beautifully crafted retreat with a gorgeous outside terrace where you can sit in the Cornish sun from dawn until dusk. Inside the open plan cabin is simply stunning. Contemporary lighting, a brilliant sound system and a Smart TV, marry seamlessly with quirky interiors where exposed brick and oak add charm and character.
The kitchen has been cleverly handcrafted, using upcycled materials. There's everything you need to whip up delicious holiday treats, so shop in one of many local farm shops and roadside stalls for the freshest of Cornish produce. Snuggle up in front of the wood-burner, perfect whatever the weather, this really is the location for all seasons.
The dreamy bed with feature brass bedstead has luxury linens, so sweet dreams are assured. The shower-room is perfect for a refreshing shower after a busy day out and about exploring the local area. Outside, the large decked space has the perfect combination of two seating areas and a dining-table so you can follow the sun or sit in the shade on a hot day. The barbecue invites you to dine al fresco surrounded by magical sub-tropical trees, paradise indeed! Porth Chapel Cabin...where your Cornish fairy-tale awaits.
There is another hideaway on site [Poldhu (4976)]( https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4976.html "Poldhu") and [Beryas Cottage (4970)]( https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-4970.html "Beryas Cottage"), but please note the properties are positioned in a way so you have plenty of privacy.

cottage.name: Little Lesquite
cottage.introText:
Pack up a bag, grab your loved one and whisk them off for a magical break away at the wonderful world of Little Lesquite! Tucked away along a country lane, with a stunning outdoor bathtub for two for under the stars bathing, miles of country rambles right on your doorstep, birds and wildlife to entertain you throughout the day (binoculars at the ready) and taking centre stage, the most gorgeous views stretching out across open countryside to the nature reserve and wildly dramatic Helman Tor. This rural idyll is the ultimate retreat for laid back lovers to soak up the great outdoors.
Whether you are lounging in the bath, bubbles of either variety optional, enjoying elevenses perched on the steps or barbecuing over the fire-pit watching the sunset at the end of a perfect day in Cornwall, relax kick back, take in that view and revitalise your senses.
Step inside and this charming shepherd's hut has been exquisitely deigned by the lovely owners who along with their dear little dog, are on hand to give you a very warm welcome and then leave you in peace to enjoy every moment of your time at Little Lesquite. Comfort and romance were surely at the top of the list with the sumptuous king-sized bed, adorned with luscious linens ensuring that lazy holiday lie ins are a must. When you are ready to cook up breakfast, the handmade kitchen comes complete with a 2 ring induction hob, electric oven, fridge, toaster, kettle and even a coffee machine - what more do you need. If you can't be tempted to eat outside, you can dine inside around the little dining-table which can be folded away when you want a little more space.
Perfect for summertime escapes and thanks to that all important wood-burner, making it even cosier on long lazy winter breaks, Little Lesquite is the perfect tonic all year round.

cottage.name: Chyandour
cottage.introText:
There are fabulous views over the sailing waters around St Mawes from both the garden and first floor living-room of this contemporary eco-house, set on the edge of St Just in Roseland on the beautiful Roseland peninsula. Looking out over green fields to the sea beyond, the wonderful sight of yachts clustering on the water in summer races and frothing waves in winter winds will prove fascinating to watch and guaranteed to delight.
Unassuming from the approach road, Chyandour looks part of a terrace of small Victorian cottages but once you’ve turned downhill and into the quiet cul-de-sac at the rear of the terrace you see the unexpected sight of a row of tall, timber-clad modern houses with peaked apex rooflines and glass-fronted balconies. Big rooms, high ceilings and an open plan living area make this a wonderfully hospitable holiday home, perfect for families and couples alike.
There are delightful creekside and coastal walks nearby, beaches galore and the iconic sailing town of St Mawes, with its fabulous restaurants, shops and galleries, just a five minute drive away.
Steps lead up from the parking-area to a smooth green lawn bordered with colourful shrubs and a patio set with outdoor dining furniture and a barbecue, a wonderful spot for family feasts on mellow summer evenings.

cottage.name: Roskennals Granary
cottage.introText:
A private driveway leads you to this very special home, nestled amidst breathtaking gardens surrounded by woodland and a bordering stream, Roskennals Granary is a charming two bedroom reverse level cottage which exudes character and idyllic countryside living. Meticulously restored with much love by its current owners (who live on site) and with great attention to detail, this property offers a combination of serenity and natural beauty.
Being Grade II Listed, Roskennals Granary is brimming with history. Climb the original Cornish granite steps and enter the thoughtfully designed open plan layout which seamlessly integrates a bespoke kitchen with plenty of room to prepare a feast of Cornish produce. A spacious dining-area and a sitting-area with sumptuous sofas to sink into, the highlight here being the dramatic floor to ceiling window flooding the room with natural light and offering uninterrupted views of the magnificent gardens. This feature window creates a special connection between the interior and the outdoors enhancing the tranquil ambience. A sweet wood-burner fills the space with warmth during cooler evenings.
Downstairs are two delightful bedrooms, one a king with plush linens and elegant finishes and the second a sweet twin, both with delightful traditional cottage windows overlooking the gardens and grounds. A luxury shower-room boasts a high end finish and sits between the two bedrooms.
Surrounding this delightful property are lovingly maintained gardens, featuring a wildlife pond, peaceful stream and a diverse range of plants, creating a sanctuary for guests and has local wildlife in abundance. Take a breath and admire the visiting heron, kingfishers and darting dragonflies and a wandering deer looking for fallen fruits - do have your camera ready! Your canine friend is also welcome to enjoy the holiday too.
This gorgeous home shares the beautiful surroundings with two other stunning cottages but seclusion and privacy are respected by the location of each one. Larger groups of friends or family could holiday together, [Roskennals Mill (5829)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-5829.html "Roskennals Mill") sleeps five and [Ellas Pottery (5831)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-5831.html "Ellas Pottery") sleeping two so why not join together and celebrate a special occasion/event in this wonderful setting?

cottage.name: Bosun's Locker
cottage.introText:
Welcome to Bosun's Locker, a hidden away apartment conveniently situated in the heart of the vibrant Roseland village of St Mawes and perfect for a car-free Cornish getaway for two.
St Mawes has all you need for a great holiday with beaches, a bustling harbour, an eclectic range of shops and the coast path all literally on your doorstep. Bosun's Locker is hidden away off the harbour and reached through a shared access alleyway off the main street. Climb a series of steps to a small number of quiet, cloistered dwellings and you will reach the front elevation of Bosun's Locker with a pretty Mediterranean terrace complete with garden furniture and sun parasol to shelter you from the Cornish rays.
All on one level, the interiors are cosy and welcoming. The living space has a sitting area, ideal for relaxing after a busy beach day and a separate breakfast-bar, perfect for two. The galley kitchen is small but perfectly formed and has all the equipment you'll need to cook a holiday meal. The comfy double bedroom is to the left of the living area, and the bathroom has a bath with a fitted shower overhead, so you can choose either a long soak or a refreshing shower. Bosun's Locker is a lovely bijou apartment, ideal for a couple looking for a Cornish getaway and perfectly situated close to all St Mawes has to offer.

cottage.name: Bryher
cottage.introText:
Bryher is a delightful barn conversion, semi-detached from [Lowenna (3133)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-3133.html "Lowenna"). The interior is contemporary, light and airy with solid wood flooring throughout and great attention to detail.
Located just a five minute walk from Porthcurnick Beach, with soft sand and rock pools galore, this is a wonderful location for a family holiday. A 10 minute stroll along the coastal footpath brings you to Portscatho, a pretty little harbourside village with its own sandy beach, a selection of shops and galleries, a couple of cafes and a popular pub. The shared orchard garden has fully enclosed lawns, lovely mature trees and sea views over the bay towards Nare Head and Gull Rock in one direction and rolling countryside in the other.

cottage.name: Lake View
cottage.introText:
Wind your way along country lanes to this idyllic haven, in the heart of the beautiful Tamar Valley, where you are sure to spend many an hour enjoying the wonderful views down to Kingsmill Lake, a tidal creek running down to the River Tamar. Set in a National Landscape (formerly known as an Area of Outstanding Natural beauty), this rural paradise is a superb location for wildlife enthusiasts, walkers and those who love peaceful countryside.
It is furnished to a very high standard and extremely comfortable throughout, with vaulted ceilings, wooden floors, gorgeous bedrooms, stylish shower-rooms, a balcony to make the most of those far reaching views and a small private garden area offering a lovely setting for dining in the great outdoors.
The owners live on site and once they and their friendly dog Laika have given you a hearty greeting they will leave you to relax and enjoy your holiday.

cottage.name: Love Lane Cottage
cottage.introText:
Nestled along a quiet rural lane in the seaside town of Penzance, Love Lane Cottage is a Grade II Listed property which exudes timeless charm and historical character. Dating back to 1675, this unique home is believed to be one of the oldest in Penzance. The cosy cottage retains much original appeal with features such as exposed beams, stone walls and an inviting ambiance that speaks of centuries of care and love. Inside this beautiful property, sleeping four, you'll discover charm and originality in equal balance.
A fully equipped traditional kitchen with all the modern appliances installed, will provide the perfect opportunity to prepare a feast for the family. The dining-room has an original ornamental Rayburn that takes pride of place adding a nostalgic touch to this social space, a superb setting for memorable gatherings. Charming window seats in the sweet sitting-room allow you to sit back and warm yourself in front of the original granite fireplace with wood-burner.
Upstairs you will discover two delightful bedrooms steeped in vintage charm with carefully chosen furnishings and decor that complement the home's heritage. A single bathroom separates the two bedrooms, and overlooks the cottage's outstanding garden.
The gently sloping garden itself is a true highlight offering seclusion and bursting with mature shrubs, colourful summer flowers, a protected wildlife haven offering tranquility and nature at its finest. At the bottom of the garden is a meadow field closed off by the owners to carefully preserve and encourage visiting insects, a sanctuary for birds in the adjacent protected woodland and visiting dragonflies to the stream below. This cherished property is a piece of Cornish history providing a special retreat, yet is so very close to the sea and all that Penzance has to offer.

cottage.name: Bokelly Cottage
cottage.introText:
As pretty as a picture and bursting with character, this idyllic retreat is waiting to welcome you to a very special holiday in north Cornwall. Set alongside the country road that leads to the little hamlet of Trelill, with gorgeous views stretching out across open countryside and glimpses of Bodmin Moor in the distance, you are only the shortest of drives to the very popular and truly stunning north Cornwall coastline.
There's a treat in store with the beautifully styled interiors, which perfectly complement the gorgeous slate floors, exposed beams, chunky thick walls and feature fireplaces which add to the overall charm. Step over the threshold into the snug - a simply gorgeous space with the sweetest of wood-burners, inviting you to pull up a pew and relax from the moment you arrive. The living and dining space is divine, with calm and relaxing interiors, a cosy wood-burner and lots of beautiful touches throughout, and the country-style galley kitchen is perfect for preparing brunch or supper with fresh ingredients picked up from the local farm shop. The large garden and sunny terrace is the perfect spot to soak in that view whether enjoying a morning coffee before you head out for a day at the beach or an evening sundowner after that exhilarating surfing lesson. And we must mention the outside shower - ideal for washing off sandy toes and salty wetsuits after a day in the sea.
The bedrooms are sure to offer a peaceful night's sleep after a day of exploring this beautiful part of the world. All have stunning views over the garden and surrounding countryside and the main bedroom has the luxury of an en suite bathroom as well. Utter bliss!

cottage.name: Hayloft
cottage.introText: This lovely stone-built barn is set back from an unspoilt country lane just outside the harbourside village of Gerrans. One of just two recently renovated barns ([Long Linhay (3142)](https://www.classic.co.uk/holiday-cottage/desc-3142.html "Long Linhay") is nearby) Hayloft is the perfect retreat for couples who love exploring the beautiful Cornish coastline and countryside. A stroll across two fields leads to the coastal footpath, with the picturesque fishing village and harbour of Portscatho and its village store, art galleries, coffee shops and pub just a 15 minute walk away. There are plenty of places to eat out, with The Hidden Hut at Porthcurnick beach, wonderful restaurants at The Rosevine and Driftwood hotels and fine dining at The Idle Rocks and Hotel Tresanton in the renowned sailing town of St Mawes.

cottage.name: The Bird Box
cottage.introText:
If you want to fly away from the everyday and immerse yourself in the very best that mother nature has to offer, then escape to this oh so special hideaway in the most magical of settings. Tucked away at the end of a country lane, this gorgeous bolthole is in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and from the minute you arrive you'll understand why.
The surrounding countryside is stunning and the views mesmerising, and your own private garden is nothing short of paradise. You are sure to while away many an hour enjoying all the beauty that surrounds whether snuggled up in the comfy king-size bed, toasting marshmallows around the fire-pit or snoozing in the hammock. And your soundtrack for the day will be the birdsong - there's a reason it's called the Bird Box you know. From the beautiful dawn chorus in the morning to the enchanting hooting of the owls who provide the encore at the end of the day, these are the best form of tweets; they soothe the soul and lift the spirits - are you feeling relaxed yet?
For an extra treat there's an outside bath made for two - how romantic is that. Nestled next to a beautiful kiwi tree, the best time to enjoy a long soak is in the evening under the starry sky, it's an unforgettable sight.
Cool and laid-back interiors perfectly complement the setting. Wake up and fling open the cabin doors to soak up the serenity of your surroundings as you enjoy your morning coffee. Utter bliss! The kitchen has everything you might need for creating yummy holiday dishes, with a very sweet seating area for holiday breakfasts before a day of adventures. If the weather turns a little chilly, there is the cutest wood-burner ever to keep you warm and toasty - making it a lovely getaway any time of the year. There's no TV or WiFi here - why would you want it - so you are in for a digital detox and if you need help getting off to sleep it will be counting stars here, lying in bed looking out of the skygazing window above - dreamy….!
Getting down to basics, in the neighbouring cabin you have a super shower to set you up for the day and that all -mportant eco-friendly compost toilet.

cottage.name: Nare View
cottage.introText:
Portscatho is a much sought-after charming seaside village on the Roseland peninsula and Nare View is perfectly situated on Gerrans Hill, just moments away from stunning beaches and the vibrant harbourside. With far reaching views to the blue sea beyond, this beautifully presented Portscatho home may become one of your favourite places to stay.
Accommodating up to six guests in three bedrooms and decorated throughout in cool natural colours, Nare View has a warm welcome whichever time of year you choose to stay. When the sun is shining, when not on the beach or out and about exploring this beautiful part of the Cornish coast, you are likely to spend much of your time outside on the terrace. A real sun-trap in warm weather, so don't forget your hat! This is also the perfect spot for a tasty breakfast before you head out for your next adventure or when there is no need to rush, a leisurely lunch with friends or family.
Open up the French doors in the living-room and bring the outside into this relaxing space, snuggle up on the sofa in front of the wood-burner with a good book or take an afternoon nap after spending a lovely day on the beach. When hunger calls head into the stylish kitchen to rustle up a delicious dinner, there's an abundance of quality produce grown locally, just take a trip to the local farm shop and take your pick. If you prefer to let someone else do the cooking, book a table at one of the local eateries, they're all good, within walking distance and offer a friendly welcome.
On the first floor choose from three lovely bedrooms, bedroom one has sea views from the bedroom window and a king-sized bed, The second bedroom, a twin room, is ideal for adults or children with full-size single beds. Bedroom three offers a cosy double bed (4'6"), please note there is limited access down each side, and the bed may be more comfortably accessed from one side only. This bedroom may therefore be better suited to children or one guest.

cottage.name: 76 Degrees Blue
cottage.introText:
This light and spacious apartment with the most spectacular sea views could just be the perfect coastal retreat. Sitting on the Sunny Corner side of Coverack, above the pretty arc-shaped bay, 76 Degrees Blue is a great base from which to explore this stunning part of the Lizard peninsula.
As you descend the 50 garden steps from the dedicated parking-area, (for those who prefer a flatter scenic walk avoiding the garden steps, there is alternative access to the ground floor via the coast path from the chapel), perhaps stop for a moment to take in the lovely blue colour of the sea. Continue further down one flight of internal stairs, through the attractive period building to the ground floor and you will find the entrance to this very well-kept apartment. Drop your bags, throw open the French doors and you will find the sheltered private garden, which boasts the most wonderful of sea views. This area is perfect for enjoying al fresco meals or just relaxing with a good book.

cottage.name: The Rigging
cottage.introText:
Come and live the coastal life at The Rigging, our most charming, white-washed cottage set in the idyllic harbourside village of Polperro. With bags of original features paired with modern day comforts, The Rigging is a haven for relaxation and a wonderful base to discover all the delights that this part of Cornwall has to offer.
Lovingly presented, the owners have created a home-from-home experience, where a warm welcome awaits. Pull into your parking area, a real bonus for Polperro, and step inside to discover your holiday haven. Set over three floors, The Rigging is deceptively spacious and surprisingly light for a traditional Cornish Cottage.
The cottage sitting-room is a calm space, accented in gentle shades to perfectly complement the setting and the kitchen/dining-room will be the place to gather for everything from holiday breakfasts, mid-morning snacks and leisurely suppers. On warmer days enjoy your meals on the sunny terrace at the front of the cottage, perhaps popping over to the historic Crumplehorn Inn for a sneaky aperitif or a glass of traditional ale. As it's only the shortest of walks away, it would be a shame not to enjoy their hospitality.
On the first floor you'll find the first of the three beautiful bedrooms, with its own en suite shower-room, along with the family bathroom. A wonderful room with a separate shower for a morning 'rise and shine' rinse and a glorious free-standing bath for a lazy holiday soak.
Heading up to the second floor you'll find the pretty double bedroom and twin room. Set under the eaves, with exposed beams and deep window seats, they are full of charm and everything you would expect from a cottage bedroom.

description.criteriaDescription: For a 1 week holiday between 03 Nov 25 and 10 Nov 25.
